lessus: <entryFree id="n26325" type="main" key="lessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lessus</orth>, <case>acc.</case> um (only in <sense id="n26325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wailing, cry, funeral lamentation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres genas ne radunto, neve lessum funeris ergo habento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but a false reading for pausam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lestrygones: <entryFree id="n26326" type="main" key="Lestry_go^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lestrȳgŏnes</orth>, v. Laestrygones.</entryFree>
lesura: <entryFree id="n26327" type="main" key="Le^su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕsūra</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕsōra</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 24, 44</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n26327.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Gaul that produced excellent cheese</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">La Lozère</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26327.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕsŭra</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a small river in Belgium, that runs into the Moselle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosell. 365</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
letabilis: <entryFree id="n26328" type="hapax" key="le_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lētābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>letum</etym>, <sense id="n26328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly, fatal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lues,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
letalis: <entryFree id="n26329" type="main" key="le_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lētālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lēthāl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly, fatal, mortal</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 580</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 392</bibl></cit>: serpens,<cb n="LETU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:40" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:155" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11</bibl></cit>. 35, 41, § <cit><quote lang="la">118: lac gustasse letale est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 236</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 351:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 351, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 165</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">in a deadly manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">letale minari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letale furens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:760" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 12, 760</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lētālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">means of death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lētālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a deadly manner, mortally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 81, § 206</bibl>: vulneratus, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 2, 7 prooem.</sense></entryFree>
lethaea: <entryFree id="n26330" type="main" key="Le_thaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēthaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Olĕnus, who, on account of her pride, was turned into stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lethaeus: <entryFree id="n26331" type="main" key="Le_thaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēthaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Lethe, II.</entryFree>
lethalis: <entryFree id="n26332" type="main" key="le_tha_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēthālis</orth>, v. letalis.</entryFree>
lethargia: <entryFree id="n26333" type="greek" key="le_thargi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēthargĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lhqargi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drowsiness, lethargy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:6:49" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:9:45" default="NO">2, 9, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lethargicus: <entryFree id="n26334" type="greek" key="le_thargi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēthargĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">lhqargiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drowsy, lethargic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 48</bibl></cit> ad Vincent.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:38 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 38 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n26334.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lē-thargĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one affected with lethargy, a lethargic person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut lethargicus hic cum fit pugil et medicum urget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 16, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lethargicos excitare labor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 11, 72, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lethargus: <entryFree id="n26335" type="greek" key="le_thargus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēthargus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lh/qargos</foreign>, <sense id="n26335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drowsy, lethargic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:613" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 613</bibl>.—Esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26335.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēthargus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. morbus), <hi rend="ital">drowsiness, lethargy</hi> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 20</bibl>, written as Greek): <cit><quote lang="la">lethargo grandi est oppressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 145</bibl></cit>; cf.: gravi lethargo oppressus, Serv. Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:106" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olfactoriis excitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 29, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lethargum vergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 38, § 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26335.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ocimum facit lethargos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:116" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 29, § 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26335.3" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. homo.) <hi rend="ital">A lethargic person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 37</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
lethe: <entryFree id="n26336" type="main" key="Le_the_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lh/qh</foreign> (forgetfulness), <sense id="n26336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the river Lethe, in the infernal regions, from which the Shades drank and obtained forgetfulness of the past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula Lethes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:4:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da mihi hebetantem pectora Lethen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immittere Lethen Stygiam alicui in viscera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>forgetfulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua Lethes, i. q. soporifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 603</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n26336.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēthaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lethe, Lethean</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26336.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 91.—</sense><sense id="n26336.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26336.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaei dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:271" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaea vincula abrumpere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring one from the Lower World back to life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Anubis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26336.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That produces sleepiness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forgetfulness, Lethean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaeo perfusa papavera somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 854</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <trans><tr>faithless love</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 648</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lethusa: <entryFree id="n26337" type="greek" key="le_thu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēthūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white poppy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
letifer: <entryFree id="n26338" type="main" key="le_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lētĭfer</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lēth-</orth>), <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>letum</etym>, <sense id="n26338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">death-bringing, death-dealing, deadly, fatal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:606" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:628" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">autumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 57</bibl></cit>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies letifer morbus canibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <trans><tr>a place in the body where a wound is fatal, a mortal part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leto: <entryFree id="n26339" type="main" key="le_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lētho</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kill, slay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgiden letavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:505" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paris hunc letat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letata corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 55</bibl></cit> (the conjectural reading letatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 19</bibl>, is very dub.; v. Orell. ad loc., where leto datus is proposed; B. and K., necatus).</sense></entryFree>
letois: <entryFree id="n26340" type="main" key="Le_to_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lētōis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lētōĭus</orth>, v. Lat-.</entryFree>
letum: <entryFree id="n26341" type="main" key="le_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lētum</orth> (sometimes written <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēthum</orth>, from a supposed connection with <foreign lang="greek">lh/qh</foreign>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 42</bibl> Müll., and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=115" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 115</bibl> Müll., from <foreign lang="greek">lh/qh</foreign>; more prob. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 665</bibl> and 898 P., from leo, whence also deleo; root lī-; cf. Sanscr. vi-lī, to dissolve; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">li/mnh, limh/n, loimo/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n26341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">death</hi> (ante-class., and in the class. period mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): ollus apparet in funeribus indictivis, cum dicitur: ollus leto datus est (qs. <hi rend="ital">was</hi> <pb n="1053" /> <cb n="LEUC" /> <hi rend="ital">given up to oblivion</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 42</bibl> Müll.—The phrase leto datus, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi>: leto dare, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, often occurs: <cit><quote lang="la">sos leto datos divos habento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: quorum liberi leto dati sunt in bello, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 13</bibl> (Trag. v. 378 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui te leto dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 355:18" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 355, 18</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. p. 79 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 806</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 328</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque largus leto dedit ingenii fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 18</bibl>: letum inimico deprecer, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:16:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 16, 10</bibl> (Trag. v. 162 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">emortuus leto malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum sibi consciscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responde, quo leto censes ut peream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leto offerre caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1041" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1041</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis letique potitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem sibi leto, quo ipse interisset, esse pereundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpi leto perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre (alicui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 872</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leto sternendus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi parere manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentant omnia letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leto jam mala finissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leto adimere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to save from death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leto se eripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari leto affici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me pessimo leto adficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novo genere leti mergi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 51, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 40, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26341.1" n="B" level="2"> Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">consanguineus Leti Sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 278</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26341.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim, subjects, <hi rend="ital">ruin, destruction</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for interitus): <cit><quote lang="la">tenues Teucrum res eripe leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 690</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum me, Juppiter Optime Maxime, domum, familiam remque meam pessimo leto afficias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:12:53:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 12, 53, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
letus: <entryFree id="n26342" type="main" key="Letus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Letus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n26342.1" n="1" level="3"> †† <orth extent="full" lang="la">leuca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">leuga</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a Celtic word, whence the Fr. <hi rend="ital">lieue</hi></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a Gallic mile of</hi> 1500 <hi rend="ital">Roman paces, a league</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*leu/kh me/tron ti *galaktiko/n</foreign>, Hesych.: <cit><quote lang="la">leuca finitur passibus mille quingentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et Latini mille passus vocent, et Galli leucas, et Persae parasangas, et rastas universa Germania, Hier. in Joel, 3, 18: exinde non millenis passibus sed leugis itinera metiuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarta leuga signabatur et decima, id est unum et viginti millia passuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1018</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1019</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5063</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leuca: <entryFree id="n26343" type="main" key="Leuca" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leuca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Calabria, near the Iapygian promontory</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Maria di Leuca</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretaque littora Leucae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 376</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leucacantha: <entryFree id="n26344" type="greek" key="leuca^cantha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucăcantha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">leucă-canthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuka/kanqa</foreign>. <sense id="n26344.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The white thorn</hi>, form leucacantha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 16, 18, § 40</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form leucacanthos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26344.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, called also phalangites and leucanthemon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 98, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucachates: <entryFree id="n26345" type="greek" key="leuca^cha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucăchātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukaxa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n26345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white agate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucadia: <entryFree id="n26346" type="main" key="Leuca^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucădĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leukadi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island (previously a peninsula) in the Ionic Sea, opposite Acarnania, with a famous temple of Apollo</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Maura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 8</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Leucada, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 289</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 172</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26346.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucădĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the island of Leucadia, Leucadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dites damnosos maritos apud Leucadiam Oppiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apollo, who had a temple in Leucadia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 42</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 69: quotannis Tristia Leucadio sacra peracta modo (the Leucadians had a custom of casting every year a criminal from a mountain into the sea; <cit><quote lang="la">they sought, however, by attaching wings to him, to break the violence of his fall, and to pick him up in boats, whereupon he was banished out of the island),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:630" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 630</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:165 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 165 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n26346.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26346.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leu-cădĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the mistress of Varro Atacinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 86.—</sense><sense id="n26346.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a comedy of Turpilius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26346.5" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucădĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Leucadia, Leucadians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26346.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of Leucadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes">11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucaethiopes: <entryFree id="n26347" type="main" key="Leucaethi^o^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucaethĭŏpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leukaiqi/opes</foreign>, <sense id="n26347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white Ethiopians of Libya</hi>, Plin. <cb n="LEUC" /> 5, 8, 8, § 43 (Jahn, Leucoe Aethiopes); <cit><quote lang="la">called also Leucoaethiopes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leucanthemis: <entryFree id="n26348" type="greek" key="leucanthe^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucanthĕmis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuka/nqemis</foreign>, <sense id="n26348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chamomile plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucanthemon: <entryFree id="n26349" type="greek" key="leucanthe^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucanthĕmon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-mum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuka/nqemon</foreign>, <sense id="n26349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of three plants</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26349.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The chamomile</hi>, called also anthemis, leucanthemis, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26349.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, called also phalangites and leucacantha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 98, § 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26349.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant whose scent resembles that of southernwood</hi> (abrotonum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 34, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucanthes: <entryFree id="n26350" type="greek" key="leucanthes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucanthes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukanqe/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb pellitory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 30, 104, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucanthus: <entryFree id="n26351" type="greek" key="leucanthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucanthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leu/kanqos</foreign>, <sense id="n26351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucargillos: <entryFree id="n26352" type="greek" key="leucargillos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucargillos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuka/rgillos</foreign>, <sense id="n26352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white clay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucas: <entryFree id="n26353" type="main" key="Leucas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leuka/s</foreign>. <sense id="n26353.0" n="I" level="1"> For Leucadia, v. h. v.—</sense><sense id="n26353.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The capital of the island Leucadia;</hi> v. Leucadia, B.—</sense><sense id="n26353.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The promontory Leucata;</hi> v. Leucata.</sense><sense id="n26353.3" n="1" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">leucaspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">leu/kaspis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">armed with a white shield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalanx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leucaspis: <entryFree id="n26354" type="main" key="Leucaspis" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucaspis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the companions of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 334</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucata: <entryFree id="n26355" type="main" key="Leuca_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucātē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucāte</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 279</bibl>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 185</bibl>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 732" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 732</bibl>), <sense id="n26355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in the island of Leucadia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo Ducato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leucatae nimbosa cacumina montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n26355.1" n="1" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">leucē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leu/kh</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n26355.2" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The spotted dead-nettle</hi>: Lamium maculatum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 77, § 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26355.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The white poplar</hi>, into which Leuce, the daughter of Oceanus, whom Pluto fell in love with and carried off to the infernal regions, was changed after her death, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26355.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of wild radish, horseradish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26355.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of white spots on the skin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 19</bibl> (shortly before written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
leuce: <entryFree id="n26356" type="main" key="Leuce_" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leukh/</foreign>. <sense id="n26356.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several islands</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26356.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Near Crete, over against Cydonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fort Suda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26356.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In the Euxine Sea, near the mouth of the Borysthenes</hi>, also called Achillea and Achillis insula, now <hi rend="ital">Oulan Adassi, Fidonisi</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Serpents' Island</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26356.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Laconia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
leuceoron: <entryFree id="n26357" type="greek" key="leuce_o^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucēŏron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukh/oron</foreign>, <sense id="n26357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also leontopodion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 34, § 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leuci: <entryFree id="n26358" type="main" key="Leuci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leuci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leu=koi</foreign>, <sense id="n26358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">adjacent to the</hi> Lingones, whence, perh., the mod. <hi rend="ital">Liège</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 64</bibl>. —Collect., in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 424</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucippe: <entryFree id="n26359" type="main" key="Leucippe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucippē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leuki/pph</foreign>. <sense id="n26359.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Thestor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 190" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 190</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26359.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Ilus, and mother of Laomedon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 250" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 250</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26359.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Thestius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26359.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: AVRELIA LEVCIPPE, Inscr. ap. Grut. 761, 7.</sense></entryFree>
leucippus: <entryFree id="n26360" type="main" key="Leucippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leu/kippos</foreign>. <sense id="n26360.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Phœbe and Hilaira, who were carried off by Castor and Pollux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:709" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 709</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26360.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucippis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Leucippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te rapuit Theseus, geminas Leucippidas illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 327</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 80" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26360.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 162" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26360.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian philosopher, a disciple of Zeno the Eleatic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucochrysos: <entryFree id="n26361" type="greek" key="leucochry_sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucochrȳsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/xrusos</foreign>. <sense id="n26361.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone, a species of chrysolite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 44, § 128</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26361.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A white precious stone, clear as crystal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucocomos: <entryFree id="n26362" type="greek" key="leuco^co^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏcŏmos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/komos</foreign> (white-haired; hence), <sense id="n26362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having white leaves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blossoms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mala) erythrocomis et leucocomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 19, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leucocoum: <entryFree id="n26363" type="greek" key="leuco^co_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏcōum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukokw=on</foreign>, <sense id="n26363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white Coan wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 8, 10, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucogaea: <entryFree id="n26364" type="greek" key="leuco^gaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏgaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/gaia</foreign> (of white earth), <sense id="n26364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone almost unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 162</bibl>. <cb n="LEUC" /></sense></entryFree>
leucogaeus: <entryFree id="n26365" type="greek" key="leuco^gaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏgaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/gaios</foreign>, <sense id="n26365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of white earth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <trans><tr>a chain of hills in Campania, where chalk was dug</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:174" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 15, 56, § 174</bibl>.—Here were the leucogaei fontes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 8, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucographia: <entryFree id="n26366" type="greek" key="leucogra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucogrăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukografi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, called also leucogaea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 59, § 162</bibl>; al. leucographitin.</sense></entryFree>
leucographis: <entryFree id="n26367" type="greek" key="leucogra^phis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucogrăphis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukografi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of St. Mary's thistle</hi>, Carduus leucographus, Linn., <hi rend="ital">which was used as a remedy for spitting blood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 78, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucoion: <entryFree id="n26368" type="main" key="leuco^i^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏĭon</orth> (trisyl. leucoja, Col. poët. 10, 97), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/i+on</foreign>, <sense id="n26368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white violet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida leucoia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leucon: <entryFree id="n26369" type="main" key="Leuco_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n26369.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of one of Actæon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 218</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26369.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:312" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 312</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leuconicus: <entryFree id="n26370" type="main" key="Leuco^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Leucŏnes</hi> (a people in Gaul), <hi rend="ital">Leuconic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:56:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 56, 9</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">sagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:159:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 159, 2</bibl></cit>, also dub.—</sense><sense id="n26370.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏ-nĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Leuconic wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:21:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 21, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leuconotus: <entryFree id="n26371" type="greek" key="leuco^no^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏnŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/notos</foreign>, <sense id="n26371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the</hi> (<hi rend="ital">white</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">clear, dry</hi>) <hi rend="ital">south wind</hi>, more precisely, <hi rend="ital">the south-southwest wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 6</bibl>: leuconotus Libs, Aus. Technopaegn. de Deis, 12.</sense></entryFree>
leucopetra: <entryFree id="n26372" type="main" key="Leuco^pe^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏpĕtra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leukope/tra</foreign> (white rock), <sense id="n26372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in the territory of the Bruttii, near Rhegium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo dell' Armi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucophaeatus: <entryFree id="n26373" type="hapax" key="leuco^phaea_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏphaeātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>leucophaeus</etym>, <sense id="n26373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in dark gray</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ash-colored garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucophaeus: <entryFree id="n26374" type="greek" key="leuco^phaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏphaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/faios</foreign>, <sense id="n26374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ash - colored, dun - colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 38, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
leucophoron: <entryFree id="n26375" type="greek" key="leucopho^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucophŏron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukofo/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n26375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gold-size</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 17, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:64" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 3, 20, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucophryna: <entryFree id="n26376" type="main" key="Leuco^phry^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏphryna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukofru/nh</foreign> (with white eyebrows), <sense id="n26376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Diana in Magnesia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucophthalmos: <entryFree id="n26377" type="greek" key="leucophthalmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucophthalmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/fqalmos</foreign> (white eye), <sense id="n26377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucopis: <entryFree id="n26378" type="greek" key="leuco_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucōpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukw=pis</foreign>, <sense id="n26378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also artemisia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucopoecilos: <entryFree id="n26379" type="greek" key="leuco^poeci^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏpoecĭlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leukopoi/kilos</foreign> (spotted with white), <sense id="n26379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucos: <entryFree id="n26380" type="greek" key="leucos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">white</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 79, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucosia: <entryFree id="n26381" type="main" key="Leuco^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leukosi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island off the coast of Lucania, near Pæstum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Licosa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leucosiamque petit, tepidique rosaria Paesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 708</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Leucothĕa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit> (Jahn reads Leucasia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
leucosyri: <entryFree id="n26382" type="main" key="Leuco^sy^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏsyri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leuko/suroi</foreign>, <sense id="n26382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white Syrians</hi> on the shores of the Euxine, afterwards called <hi rend="ital">Cappadocians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucothea: <entryFree id="n26383" type="main" key="Leuco^the^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏthĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏthĕē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leukoqe/h</foreign>. <sense id="n26383.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of Ino, daughter of Cadmus, after she was received among the sea-gods; afterwards confounded with the Italian goddess Matuta</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leucotheë Graiis Matuta vocabare nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:545" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 545</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Leucothee (others Leucothea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 542</bibl></cit>: Ino Leucothea nominata a Graecis; <cit><quote lang="la">Matuta habetur a nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 48</bibl>.—In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:402" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 402</bibl>, identical with <hi rend="ital">Aurora</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n26383.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name for</hi> Leucosia, v. h. v.—</sense><sense id="n26383.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fountain in the island of Samos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 37, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucothoe: <entryFree id="n26384" type="main" key="Leuco^tho^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucŏthŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Orchamus, king of Babylon, and Eurynome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 196</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">204</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
leucozomus: <entryFree id="n26385" type="greek" key="leuco^zo_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucŏzōmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leuko/zwmos</foreign>, <sense id="n26385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with white sauce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:9:section=254" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 9, § 254</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leucrion: <entryFree id="n26386" type="greek" key="leucri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also cynoglossa, <hi rend="ital">hound's-tongue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucrocota: <entryFree id="n26387" type="main" key="leucro^co^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leucrŏcŏta</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕōcrŏcŏta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">leucrŏcŭta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild beast in India</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leuctra: <entryFree id="n26388" type="main" key="Leuctra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leuctra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Leuctrae</orth>, ārum. <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*leu=ktra</foreign>. <sense id="n26388.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town in Bæotia, where Epaminondas defeated the</hi> <pb n="1054" /> <cb n="LEVI" /> <hi rend="ital">Spartans</hi>, now the village of <hi rend="ital">Leuca</hi>, with the ruins of <hi rend="ital">Eremo-Castro</hi> (cf. Mann. Griechenland, p. 238), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemoniorum mala pugna in Leuctris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26388.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leuctrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Leuctra, Leuctrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Cicero jestingly gives to the fray in which Milo killed Clodius the name of Leuctrica pugna (because Rome was thereby delivered from the yoke of Clodius, as Greece had been from that of the Spartans by the battle of Leuctra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:6:1:26" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 6, 1, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26388.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town in Laconica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Leftro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leucus: <entryFree id="n26389" type="main" key="Leucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Leuci.</entryFree>
leudus: <entryFree id="n26390" type="main" key="leudus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leudus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Germ. Lied, Laut), <sense id="n26390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German song</hi>, Ven. Fort. 7, 8, 69.</sense></entryFree>
leuga: <entryFree id="n26391" type="main" key="leuga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leuga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. leuca.</entryFree>
leunculus: <entryFree id="n26392" type="main" key="le^uncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>leo</etym>, <sense id="n26392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 28, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leus: <entryFree id="n26393" type="greek" key="le_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">lei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n26393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica lea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leuson: <entryFree id="n26394" type="greek" key="leuson"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leuson</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lou=sson</foreign>, <sense id="n26394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inner part of the wood of the fir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hoc lignum, proximum medullae) in abiete leuson Graeci vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 73, § 187</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levabilis: <entryFree id="n26395" type="hapax" key="le^va_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>levo</etym>, <sense id="n26395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be lightened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:7:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 7, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levaci: <entryFree id="n26396" type="main" key="Leva_ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Levāci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">allies of the Nervii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl>; cf. Ukert, Gall. p. 374.</sense></entryFree>
levamen: <entryFree id="n26397" type="main" key="le^va_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>levo</etym>, <sense id="n26397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alleviation, mitigation, solace, consolation</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): quod si esset aliquod levamen, id esset in te uno, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 16</bibl>: dulce viatori lasso in sudore levamen, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 61</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 63: omnis curae casusque levamen, Amitto Anchisen, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 709</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levamentarius: <entryFree id="n26398" type="main" key="le^va_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>levamentum</etym>, <sense id="n26398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for lightening</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 13, 5, 1.</sense></entryFree>
levamentum: <entryFree id="n26399" type="main" key="le^va_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. levo</etym>, <sense id="n26399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alleviation, mitigation, consolation, comfort</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">miseriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine levamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud levamentum quam si certis sub legibus militia iniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi illam rem fore levamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 43, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levana: <entryFree id="n26400" type="main" key="Le^va_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕvāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess supposed to raise new-born infants from the ground</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11.</sense></entryFree>
levatio: <entryFree id="n26401" type="main" key="le^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n26401.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lifting up, raising, elevating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerum levationes facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl></cit>; a metrical t. t. = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rsis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mas. II. 18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mas. II. 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26401.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26401.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An alleviation, mitigation, relief</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui esse levationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae levationem habeant aegritudinum,</quote> <trans><tr>may produce an alleviation, may alleviate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levationem invenire acerbissimis doloribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris at officii debiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26401.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A diminishing</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
levator: <entryFree id="n26402" type="main" key="le^va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lifter, a thief</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
levatus: <entryFree id="n26403" type="main" key="le^va_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. lĕvo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n26404" type="main" key="le_va_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. lēvo.</entryFree>
levenna: <entryFree id="n26405" type="hapax" key="le^venna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for 1. levis: <sense id="n26405.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">(Laberius) hominem levennam pro levi dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leviculus: <entryFree id="n26406" type="main" key="le^vi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. levis]. * </sense><sense id="n26406.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very small, trivial, insignificant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid significet prandium caninum, rem leviculam, diu et anxie quaesivimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:31:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 31, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26406.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Somewhat light-minded, vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviculus sane noster Demosthenes, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levidensis: <entryFree id="n26407" type="main" key="le^vi^densis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭdensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. levis-densus</etym>, <sense id="n26407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightly wrought, thin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26407.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: levidensis vestis dicta, quod raro filo sit leviterque densata. Pavitensis contraria levidensi dicta, quod graviter pressa atque calcata sit; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 19</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26407.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">slight, poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levifecit: <entryFree id="n26408" type="gloss" key="le^vi^fe_cit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭfēcit</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">e)couqe/nhsen</foreign> (<sense id="n26408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he set at naught</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
levifidus: <entryFree id="n26409" type="hapax" key="le^vi^fi_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭ-fīdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. levis</etym>, <sense id="n26409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of slight credit, untrustworthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sunt lenae levifidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>. <cb n="LEVI" /></sense></entryFree>
levigatio: <entryFree id="n26410" type="hapax" key="le_vi^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. levigo</etym>, <sense id="n26410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smoothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
levigatus: <entryFree id="n26411" type="main" key="le_vi^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. levigo.</entryFree>
levigo: <entryFree id="n26412" type="main" key="le_vi^go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. lēvis</etym>, <sense id="n26412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make smooth, to smooth</hi> (not in Cic.; syn. polio, dolo, limo). </sense><sense id="n26412.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes parietes tectorio levigantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid opere tectorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad levigandam cutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 3, 10, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to make slippery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabritia levigatur dente conchāve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26412.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make small, bruise small, pulverize, levigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae diligenter contrita levigantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galla cum austero vino levigata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:5" default="NO">9, 13, 5</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., smooth, slippery</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum levigatius et spissius est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26413" type="main" key="le^vi^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. levis</etym>, <sense id="n26413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make light, lighten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravia, Cassiod. de Amic. prol. § 33: pondus sollicitudinis, Gregor. Ep. 7, 76: omni sarcinā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 142, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levio: <entryFree id="n26414" type="main" key="le^vio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvio</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to alleviate</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Vit. Leob. 23.</sense></entryFree>
levipes: <entryFree id="n26415" type="main" key="le^vi^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭpes</orth>, <itype>pēdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. levis-pes</etym>, <sense id="n26415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightfooted</hi> (rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 6</bibl>: levipes Lepus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
levir: <entryFree id="n26416" type="main" key="le_vir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvir</orth>, <itype>ĭri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for dēvir, kindred with Sanscr. dēvar, whence juvān = juvenis; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dah/r</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a husband's brother, brother-inlaw</hi>: viri frater levir est: apud Graecos <foreign lang="greek">dah\r</foreign> appellatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4, § 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levir dicitur frater mariti, quasi laevus vir,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 557, 8</bibl></cit>: levir est uxori meae frater meus (i. e. <hi rend="ital">my brother is</hi> levir <hi rend="ital">to my wife</hi>), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=115" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 115</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
levis: <entryFree id="n26417" type="main" key="le^vis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for leg-vis; Sanscr. laghu-s, little; cf. O. H. Germ. ring-i; Germ. gering; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)laxu/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light</hi> in weight, <hi rend="ital">not heavy</hi> (opp. gravis). </sense><sense id="n26417.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviora corpora (opp. graviora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levior quam pluma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 289</bibl></cit>: armatura, <hi rend="ital">light armor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis armaturae Numidae,</quote> <trans><tr>the light-armed Numidians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
