G. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; also, by metonymy, <hi rend="ital">lightarmed troops;</hi> v. armatura, and cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec fuerit nobis tamquam levis armaturae prima orationis excursio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>a light-armed soldier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of clothing: nudi, aut sagulo leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebis in solo levis angiportu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of the earth upon the dead: <cit><quote lang="la">terraque securae sit super ossa levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:50" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. on tombstones: sit tibi terra levis (abbreviated, S. T. T. L.): per leves populos,</quote> <trans><tr>the shades, bodiless persons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgaque levem coerces aurea turbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: fessis leviora tolli Pergama Grais, <hi rend="ital">a lighter burden</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">easier to be destroyed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26417.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26417.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Light</hi> of digestion, <hi rend="ital">easy to digest</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae in aqua degunt, leviorem cibum praestant. Inter domesticas quadrupedes levissima suilla est, gravissima bubula,</quote> <trans><tr>lightest of digestion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves malvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 16</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi Malvae salubres corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 57</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n26417.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Light</hi> in motion, <hi rend="ital">swift, quick, fleet, nimble, rapid</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">agilis, alacer, pernix): ipsa (diva) levi fecit volitantem flamine currum (i. e. Argo),</quote> <trans><tr>a quick, favorable wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">leves venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:162" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <trans><tr>light, swift</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi deducens pollice filum,</quote> <trans><tr>light, nimble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pollex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:767" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 767</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 599: peltam pro parma fecit, ut ad motus concursusque essent leviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messapus levis cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves Parthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:389" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nympharumque leves cum Satyris chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaere modos leviore plectro,</quote> <trans><tr>nimbler, gayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et levis erecta consurgit ad oscula plantā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:507" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 507</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes ire leves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:488" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:605" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levior discurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:549" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo levis terrore moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <trans><tr>fleeting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>light, thin soil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ubi montana (loca) quod leviora et ideo salubriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (opp graviora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26417.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Slight, trifling, small</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): ignis, <cb n="LEVI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 488</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus,</quote> <trans><tr>a slight, gentle touch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:840" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 840</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:413" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 413</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n26417.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26417.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without weight</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of no consequence;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">light, trifling, unimportant, inconsiderable, trivial, slight, little, petty, easy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunquam erit alienis gravis qui suis se concinnat levem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave est nomen imperii atque id etiam in levi persona pertimescitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve et infirmum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: quae mihi ad spem obtinendae veritatis gravissima sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">ad motum animi ... leviora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod alia quaedam inania et levia conquiras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditio,</quote> <trans><tr>a light, unfounded report</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui res et pecunia levissima et existimatio sanctissima fuit semper,</quote> <trans><tr>something very insignificant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem merita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviore de causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia levibus flagrantia causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:182" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effutire leves indigna tragoedia versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 231</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in levi habitum,</quote> <trans><tr>was made little of, was regarded as a trifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levia sed nimium queror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 63" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid leviora loquor? Petr. poët. 134, 12: non est leve tot puerorum observare manus,</quote> <trans><tr>no easy matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:240" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid levius putaris,</quote> <trans><tr>easier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 344</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26417.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">opum levior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:102" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26417.9" n="B" level="2"> In disposition or character. </sense><sense id="n26417.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Light, light-minded, capricious, fickle, inconstant, unreliable, false</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo levior quam pluma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me leviorem erga te putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu levior cortice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium levium hominum atque fallacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam saepe in parva pecunia perspiciuntur quam sint leves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves ac nummarii judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 28, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit precor illa levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi brachio aliquid agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid levius aut turpius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <trans><tr>vain, empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviores mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26417.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mild, gentle, pleasant</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quos qui leviore nomine appellant, percussores vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 93</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">levior reprehensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem eo, quod levissimum videbatur, decursum est,</quote> <trans><tr>the gentlest, mildest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec leves somnos timor aut cupido Sordidus aufert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium,</quote> <trans><tr>mild, tolerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕ-vĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">lightly, not heavily</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26417.12" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">armati,</quote> <trans><tr>light-armed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—Of the blow of a weapon: <cit><quote lang="la">levius casura pila sperabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26417.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26417.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Slightly, a little, not much, somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter densae nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflexum bacillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae leviter eminentes (al. leniter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (medici) leviter aegrotantes leniter curant, gravioribus autem morbis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non leviter lucra liguriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnoscere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto constantior idem In vitiis, tanto levius miser,</quote> <trans><tr>so much less</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut levissime dicam,</quote> <trans><tr>to express it in the mildest manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26417.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Easily, lightly, without difficulty, with equanimity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id eo levius ferendum est, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed levissime feram, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levius torquetis Arachne,</quote> <trans><tr>more dexterously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26418" type="main" key="le_vis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvis</orth> (erroneously <orth extent="full" lang="la">laevis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lei=os, leuro/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smooth, smoothed, not rough</hi>, opp. asper (class.). </sense><sense id="n26418.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26418.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpuscula quaedam levia, alia aspera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis (spectatur): leves an asperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus levem eum (mundum) fecit et undique aequabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <trans><tr>smooth, shining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levissima corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma pectine levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascunturque leves per digitos umerosque plumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levior assiduo detritis aequore conchis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 792</bibl></cit>: inimicus pumice levis, <hi rend="ital">rubbed</hi> (cf. pumicatus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 95</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: levi cum sanguine Nisus labitur infelix, <hi rend="ital">slippery</hi>,<pb n="1055" /> <cb n="LEVO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 328</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis Juventas ( = imberbis),</quote> <trans><tr>smooth, without hair, beardless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit> (8), 31: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:115" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:12" default="NO">2, 12</bibl>; hence, also, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">youthful, delicate, beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 815</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 698</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">finely dressed, spruce, effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 437</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:82" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 82</bibl>: argentum, <hi rend="ital">smooth, not engraved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chased</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 62</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">externi ne quid valeat per leve morari,</quote> <trans><tr>smoothness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 87</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per leve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:64" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per levia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26418.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rubbed smooth, ground down, softened, soft</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 228" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26418.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">smooth, flowing</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio (opp. aspera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">levis verborum concursus (opp. asper),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis et aspera (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis et quadrata compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levia ac nitida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aures) fragosis offenduntur et levibus mulcentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 116</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
levisomnus: <entryFree id="n26419" type="hapax" key="le^vi^somnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭsomnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. levissomnus</etym>, <sense id="n26419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightly sleeping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 864</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levisticum: <entryFree id="n26420" type="main" key="Le^visti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕvistĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. Ligusticum (q. v.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 52</bibl> Gesn.</entryFree>
levita: <entryFree id="n26421" type="main" key="Le_vi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēvīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Levites <sense id="n26421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
levitas: <entryFree id="n26422" type="main" key="le^vi^tas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. levis</etym>, <sense id="n26422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightness</hi>, as to weight. </sense><sense id="n26422.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">plumarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 387</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 745</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli fruticum levitas major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 123</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26422.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">movableness, mobility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Termine, post illud levitas tibi libera non est: Qua positus fueris in statione, mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:673" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 673</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26422.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26422.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Light-mindedness, changeableness, fickleness, inconstancy, levity</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid est inconstantiā, mobilitate, levitate turpius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temere assentientium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in populari ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobilitas et levitas animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adversas res, sic secundas immoderate ferre, levitatis est,</quote> <trans><tr>lightness of mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatoriis levitatibus dediti,</quote> <trans><tr>frivolities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manet in rebus temere congestis levitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnamus igitur omnis ineptias—quod enim lenius huic levitati nomen inponam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26422.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">shallowness, superficialness</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 17, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26423" type="main" key="le_vi^tas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">laev-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. lēvis</etym>, <sense id="n26423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smoothness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26423.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">speculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestinorum,</quote> <trans><tr>slipperiness, lubricity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26423.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">smoothness, fluency, facility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes nihil levitate Aeschini et splendore verborum cedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 31, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effeminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leviter: <entryFree id="n26424" type="main" key="le^vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. levis <sense id="n26424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
levites: <entryFree id="n26425" type="main" key="Le_vi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēvītes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēvīta</orth>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 39; 5, 30), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Levite</hi>: Levita de tribu sacra, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 39; 5, 30. </sense><sense id="n26425.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a deacon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26425.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26425.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lē-vītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Levi</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the Levites, Levitical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus Leviticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ios. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26425.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēvītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the tribe of Levi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentis Levitidis una Semper fida comes,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Levites</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 502</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levitonarium: <entryFree id="n26426" type="main" key="le_vi_to_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvītōnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian monk's garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22</bibl>; Hier. praef. in Reg. S. Pachom. n. 4.</sense></entryFree>
levitudo: <entryFree id="n26427" type="main" key="le_vi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvĭtūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">laev-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. levis</etym>, <sense id="n26427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smoothness</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">levitudo granorum (miliorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levo: <entryFree id="n26428" type="main" key="le^vo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form of <sense id="n26428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> levasso, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. levis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lift up, raise, elevate</hi> (syn.: extollo, erigo). </sense><sense id="n26428.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ter sese attollens cubitoque annixa levavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de caespite,</quote> <trans><tr>to rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:528" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se matura levarit progenies (avium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apis se confestim levat sublimius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:122" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 16, 24, § 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hiemem, quae altius levat Alpes, i. e. by the snow,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26428.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26428.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make lighter, lighten, to relieve, ease</hi>: cantantes <cb n="LEX" /> ut eamus, ego te fasce levabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentum colla levavit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>alighted from the dragon-car</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>to clean the teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactatur rerum utilium pars maxima, sed nec damna levant,</quote> <trans><tr>do not lighten the ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26428.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take away, take</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcā levat ille bicorni sordida terga suis,</quote> <trans><tr>takes down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui manicas atque arcta Vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise, levy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:4:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 4, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26428.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lighten, relieve, console, refresh, support</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">with</hi> any thing (freq. and class.). —Of a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">non nihil enim me levant tuae litterae hoc tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of things as objects: O Tite, si quid te adjuero curamve levasso, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 339 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">auxilio viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 538</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam et angorem animi sermone et consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fonte sitim,</quote> <trans><tr>to slake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida ora aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>to refresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 230</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">membra gramine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 328</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levantur tamen miserae civitates, quod nullus fit sumptus in nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26428.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26428.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lighten, lessen, alleviate, mitigate</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laxo, libero): meam egestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui paupertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiam multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutari arte fessos Corporis artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi vim levaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levavitque apertis horreis pretia frugum,</quote> <trans><tr>reduced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vario viam sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:59:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 59, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sumptus levaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 43</bibl></cit> (52), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatem innocentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his levabat omnem vulnerum metum nobilitas mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui paupertatem levet propinqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:236" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 236</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26428.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lessen, diminish, weaken, impair</hi>: cave lassitudo poplitum cursum levet, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 336, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconstantiā levatur auctoritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa fidem promissa levant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26428.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To relieve, release, discharge, free from</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n26428.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">leva me hoc onere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem miseriis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me molestia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hac opinione non modo verbis, sed etiam opere levandi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines populares supplicio aut exsilio levarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aere alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se infamiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:61:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 61, § 141</bibl></cit>: se vitā, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 336, 33</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26428.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me omnium jam laborum levas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26428.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To avert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictum dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26429" type="main" key="le_vo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">laevo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. levis</etym>, <sense id="n26429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make smooth, to smooth, polish</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare ac radere tigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1267</bibl></cit>: corpus, * Cic. Fragm. Or. in Clod. et Cur. 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni levatique mensarum orbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Helv. 11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Helv. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:519" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 519</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26429.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">to smooth down, polish, soften</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis aspera sano Levabit cultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 123</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvātus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae levatiora levioraque sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>more highly polished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
levor: <entryFree id="n26430" type="main" key="le_vor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēvor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">laevor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smoothness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud sine principali aliquo levore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectantur in chartis tenuitas, densitas, candor, levor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levorem corpori afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 14, 43, § 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 4, 15, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 552</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lex: <entryFree id="n26431" type="main" key="lex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lex</orth>, <itype>lēgis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. Sanscr. root lag-, lig-, to fasten; Lat. ligo, to bind, oblige; cf. religio</etym>, <sense id="n26431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">motion for a law</hi> made to the people by a magistrate, <hi rend="ital">a bill</hi> (cf. institutum). </sense><sense id="n26431.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem ferre: antiquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges ac jura ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem promulgavit pertulitque, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius fixit legem a dictatore comitiis latam, qua, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem sciscere de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus R. jussit legem de civitate tribuenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26431.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bill which has become a law</hi> in consequence of its adoption by the people in the comitia, <hi rend="ital">a law</hi> (cf.: jus, fas; decretum, edictum, scitum): <cb n="LEX" /> legem constituere alicui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 14, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem gravem alicui imponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem neglegere, evertere, perfringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegere, perrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges ac jura labefactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 34</bibl></cit>: leges duodecim tabularum, <hi rend="ital">the laws composed by the decemvirs</hi>, the foundation of Roman legislation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc barbaricā lege certumst jus meum omne persequi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by the Roman law, that of the Twelve Tables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in phrases. </sense><sense id="n26431.5" n="1" level="3"> Lege and legibus, <hi rend="ital">according to law, by law, legally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus morte ea ad me lege redierunt bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenas deductus est, ut ibi de eo legibus fieret judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.6" n="2" level="3"> Legis actio, <hi rend="ital">a statutory process</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones quas in usu veteres habuerunt legis actiones appellabantur, vel ideo quod legibus proditae sunt, ... vel ideo quia ipsarum legum verbis accommodatae erant, et ideo inmutabiles proinde atque leges observabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:11" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. § 12 sqq.—</sense><sense id="n26431.7" n="3" level="3"> Hence, in partic.: lege agere, <hi rend="ital">to proceed strictly according to law</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26431.8" n="a" level="4"> Of the lictor, <hi rend="ital">to execute a sentence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fulvius praeconi imperavit, ut lictorem lege agere juberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26431.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bring a legal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">statutory action</hi>: una injuria est tecum. <hi rend="ital">Chr.</hi> Lege agito ergo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 90</bibl>: lege agito dicebatur ei cujus intentio contemptibilis adversario videbatur, Don. ad Ter. l. l.: lege agito mecum; <cit><quote lang="la">molestus ne sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege egit in hereditatem paternam exheres filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.10" n="4" level="3"> Fraudem legi facere, <hi rend="ital">to evade the law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne legi fraudem faciant aleariae, adcuratote ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the law against dicing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod emancupando filium fraudem legi fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: facio fraudem senatus consulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.11" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a law, precept, regulation, principle, rule, mode, manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui disciplinam suam legem vitae putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis condicio lexque vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec lex in amicitia sauciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero cur vir bonus has sibi tam gravis leges imposuerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex veri rectique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam legem vitae accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad legem naturae revertamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 25:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges in historia observandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis nescit primam esse historiae legem, ne quid falsi dicere audeat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:15:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 15, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus est lex amicitiae, ut idem amici semper velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ad legem formanda est oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versibus est certa quaedam et definita lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus suis (i. e. philosophiae) parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges Epicuri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 37, 108</bibl></cit>; 4, 4, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus lex sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra leges loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex et ratio loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:453" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum grammaticam legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem esse aiunt disciplinae dialecticae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:10:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ingens rerum numerus jubet atque operum lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scimus hujus opusculi illam esse legem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui titulus sola metri lege constringitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">quā sidera lege mearent,</quote> <trans><tr>by what law, what rule</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 71</bibl></cit>.—Hence, sine lege, <hi rend="ital">without order, in confusion, confusedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspatiantur equi ... quaque impetus egit, Hac sine lege ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacent collo sparsi sine lege capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in lege loci commoda Circus habet,</quote> <trans><tr>quality, nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lege loci sumit mutatque figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hal. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A contract, agreement, covenant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam faciundam hac lege oportet locare, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mancipii lege,</quote> <trans><tr>a contract of sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 178</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Manilianas venalium vendendorum leges ediscere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 58, 246</bibl></cit>: collegii Aesculapii, Inscr. ap. Fabrett. p. 724, n. 443.—</sense><sense id="n26431.13" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A condition, stipulation</hi> (cf. condicio). </sense><sense id="n26431.14" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego dabo ei talentum, primus qui in crucem excucurrerit, Set ca lege, ut offigantur bis pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nequit, qua lege licuit velle dixit fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: estne empta mi haec? <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> His legibus<pb n="1056" /> <cb n="LIBA" />  habeas licet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac lege tibi adstringo meam fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta tibi est lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vos saevas imponite leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.15" n="2" level="3"> Hence of conditions or terms of peace: <cit><quote lang="la">pax data Philippo in has leges est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ante dictum est legibus, pacem fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacemque his legibus constituerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sub leges pacis iniquae Tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges et foedera jungere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in leges ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26431.16" n="F" level="1"> In eccl. Lat. esp., <hi rend="ital">the law of Moses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite putare quoniam veni solvere legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">often called lex Moysi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 15, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but more freq. lex Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esdr. 10, 28 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">also cf.: lex Altissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:19:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eccl. 19, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 39, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">118, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also of <hi rend="ital">a precept of the Mosaic law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista est lex animantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istae sunt leges quas constituit Dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 30, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lexanor: <entryFree id="n26432" type="main" key="Lexa_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lexānor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:686" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 686</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lexidium: <entryFree id="n26433" type="greek" key="lexi^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lexĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leci/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n26433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little word</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lexidia colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lexipyretos: <entryFree id="n26434" type="greek" key="lexi^py^re^tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lexĭpyrĕtos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>on and a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">lhcipu/retos</foreign>, <sense id="n26434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that allays fever, antifebrile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 201</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lexipyrexia: <entryFree id="n26435" type="greek" key="lexi^py^rexi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lexĭpyrexĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lhcipureci/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cessation of fever</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lexis: <entryFree id="n26436" type="greek" key="lexis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lexis</orth>, <itype>ĕos</itype> (<sense id="n26436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> -eis), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">le/cis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a word</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): quam lepide lexeis compostae! Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">251</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
lexobii: <entryFree id="n26437" type="main" key="Lexobi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lexobĭi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lexovĭi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">at the mouth of the</hi> Sequana, whence the name of the modern <hi rend="ital">Lisieux</hi>, Départ. du Calvados, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liaculum: <entryFree id="n26438" type="gloss" key="lia_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">liācŭlum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">leianth/r</foreign> (<sense id="n26438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polishing instrument</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
libacunculus: <entryFree id="n26439" type="hapax" key="li_ba_cuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībācuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>libum</etym>, <sense id="n26439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de libacunculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 27</bibl></cit> (al. lucunculo).</sense></entryFree>
libadion: <entryFree id="n26440" type="greek" key="li^ba^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbădĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">liba/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n26440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb centaury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 31, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libamen: <entryFree id="n26441" type="main" key="li_ba_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>libo</etym>, <sense id="n26441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is poured out in offerings to the gods, a drinkoffering, libation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for libamentum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:733" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 733</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingui cumulat libamine flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:204" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">setas Ignibus imponit, libamina prima,</quote> <trans><tr>the hairs offered as a beginning of the sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 246</bibl></cit>.—So (eccl. Lat.) of the Mosaic drinkofferings: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum libaminum bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:32:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 32, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 29, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26441.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which is thrown upon a funeral pile, an offering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:224" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26441.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the first enjoyment</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nova servatae capies: libamina famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libamentum: <entryFree id="n26442" type="main" key="li_ba_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is poured out in offerings to the gods, a drinkoffering, libation</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n26442.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sacrificiorum libamenta serventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libamenta Veneri solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego nascentes laetus bacchatus ad aras libamenta tuli,</quote> <trans><tr>offerings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:163" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona magnifica, quasi libamenta praedarum,</quote> <trans><tr>first-fruits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec est lex sacrificii et libamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 6, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. libamen, I. A.).—</sense><sense id="n26442.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26442.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is tasted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varia illa libamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26442.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A trial, first attempt, a sample, specimen</hi> (post-class. and very rare): primitias quasdam et quasi libamenta ingenuarum artium dedimus, Gell. N. A. praef. § 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:16:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libanios: <entryFree id="n26443" type="greek" key="li^ba^ni^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbănĭos</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">liba/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n26443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine, with the odor of frankincense, growing in the island of Thasos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libanitis: <entryFree id="n26444" type="greek" key="li^ba^ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbănītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">libani=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n26444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also polion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libanochrus: <entryFree id="n26445" type="greek" key="li^ba^no^chru_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbănŏchrūs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">libano/xrous</foreign> (frankincense-colored), <sense id="n26445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libanotis: <entryFree id="n26446" type="greek" key="li^ba^no_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbănōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">libanwti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rosemary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 62, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:172" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 16, 64, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libanus: <entryFree id="n26447" type="main" key="Li^ba^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbănus</orth> (scanned Lībănus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 55</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*li/banos</foreign> (Hebr. Lĕbānōn), <sense id="n26447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Mount Lebanon, in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Techn. Idyll. 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 4, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26447.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībănus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Lebanon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libana cedrus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26447.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="LIBE" /> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">c., frankincense</hi> (pure Lat. tus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 24, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26448" type="main" key="Li^ba^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libarius: <entryFree id="n26449" type="main" key="li_ba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>libum</etym>, <sense id="n26449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pastry-cook, confectioner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libatio: <entryFree id="n26450" type="main" key="li_ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libo</etym>, <sense id="n26450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink-offering, libation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Harusp. Resp. 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa, in qua epulae, libationesque reponuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26450.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Mosaic drink-offering</hi> ( = libamentum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:28:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 28, 24 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
libator: <entryFree id="n26451" type="hapax" key="li_ba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes a libation</hi>: cenarum libator, Front. de Fer. Als. ep. 3 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
libatorium: <entryFree id="n26452" type="main" key="li_ba_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the vessel in which a libation was offered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Esr. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libella: <entryFree id="n26453" type="main" key="li_bella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>libra</etym>. <sense id="n26453.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An</hi> as, <hi rend="ital">a small silver coin, the tenth part of a</hi> denarius: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi denarii decuma libella, quod libram pondo aeris valebat, et erat ex argento parva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=174" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 174</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">librales, unde etiam nunc libella dicitur et dupondius, appendebantur asses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15, 1</bibl>: sunt enim in sestertio libellae decem, singulae viginti, teruncii quadraginta, Volus.
