Maec. 66.—</sense><sense id="n26453.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n26453.2" n="1" level="3"> Prov. for <hi rend="ital">a very small sum of money</hi>, as with us <hi rend="ital">a farthing, groat, cent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">una libella liber possum fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi libellam argenti numquam credam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi neque libellai spes sit usquam gentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom libella nusquamst, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Volcatio unam libellam dedisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, ad libellam, i. q. ad assem, <hi rend="ital">to a farthing, to a cent, exactly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26453.3" n="2" level="3"> In inheritances: ex libella, i. q. ex asse, <hi rend="ital">sole heir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curius fecit palam te ex libella, me ex teruncio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26453.4" n="II" level="1"> An instrument for detecting any variation from a perfectly horizontal surface, <hi rend="ital">a level, water-level, plummetline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libella aliqua si ex parti claudicat hilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocare et expolire aliquid ad regulam et libellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">structuram (parietis) ad normam et libellam fieri, et ad perpendiculum respondere oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus qui est ad libellam aequus,</quote> <trans><tr>quite, perfectly level</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
libellaris: <entryFree id="n26454" type="main" key="li^bella_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbellāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>libellus</etym>, <sense id="n26454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to books, book-</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans><tr>a written work, writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libellatici: <entryFree id="n26455" type="main" key="li^bella_ti^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbellātĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a term applied to Christians who, during the persecutions, purchased false certificates of a magistrate that they had sacrificed in the heathen manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libellensis: <entryFree id="n26456" type="main" key="li^bellensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbellensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an officer who presented petitions to the emperor and registered them</hi>, Cod. 7, 62, 32; 12, 19, 14; 3, 24, 3.</sense></entryFree>
libellio: <entryFree id="n26457" type="main" key="li^belli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n26457.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A notary</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 28</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26457.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poor bookseller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de capsa miseri libellionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libellulus: <entryFree id="n26458" type="main" key="li^bellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbellŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very little book</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 289</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libellus: <entryFree id="n26459" type="main" key="li^bellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>3. liber</etym>. * <sense id="n26459.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The inner bark</hi> of a tree, used for writing-tablets: levis in aridulo malvae descripta libello (carmina), Cinna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 12</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26459.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a little book, pamphlet</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a book written in pages</hi>, and not in long rolls: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae, quas primus videtur ad paginas et formam memorialis libelli convertisse (opp. transversa charta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n26459.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsi etiam illud quodam in libello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quodam joculari libello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:15" default="NO">2, 13, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi dono lepidum novum libellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribilis et sacer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid hoc libelli est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellis eum (Scipionem) palaestraeque operam dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri farrago libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 86</bibl></cit>.—Of a single satire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.3" n="2" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bookseller's shop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te (quaesivimus) in omnibus libellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 4</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. labellis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:20:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 20, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi> of any kind. </sense><sense id="n26459.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A memorandumbook, journal, diary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid memoriae causā retulit in libellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commentariolis et chirographis et libellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl>, <cb n="LIBE" /> 7, 31; 11, 3, 142; 6, 2, 5.—</sense><sense id="n26459.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A memorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illi in libellis laudationum decreta miserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 69, 197</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A petition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticus libellum composuit: eum mihi dedit, ut darem Caesari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">libellum alicui porrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplices libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:31:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem posce libello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:193" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 193</bibl></cit>: libellos signare, subnotare, <hi rend="ital">to answer petitions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos signare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subnotare libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad libellum rescribere, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 3, 3, 5: libellos agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to have the charge of answering petitions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: a libellis, <hi rend="ital">the officer charged with receiving petitions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epaphroditum a libellis capitali poena condemnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 587, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">A LIBELLIS ADIVTOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 587, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A note of invitation</hi>, to hear a lecture, see a play, etc., <hi rend="ital">a notice, programme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum libellos venditare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum mutuatur et subsellia conducit et libellos dispergit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9</bibl></cit>: munerarius, <hi rend="ital">the programme of a festival</hi>, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A public notification, announcement, placard, handbill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere per libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos Sex. Alfenus, procurator P. Quincti, deicit,</quote> <trans><tr>tears down the auction handbills</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensum amici bonis libellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestitur tota libellis porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.10" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A letter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(laetitias) in libello hoc opsignato quas tuli pausillulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit> (cf. epistulam, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> v. 26): <cit><quote lang="la">libellum ipsius habeo in quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: ut ex libellis ejus animadverti, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 11, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26459.11" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A libel, lampoon, pasquinade</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">libellos aut carmina ad infamiam cujuspiam edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsos de se in Curia famosos libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive quis ad infamiam alicujus libellum aut carmen scripserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:220" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam patimur ... famosis libellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.12" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A written accusalion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">complaint</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">componunt ipsae per se formantque libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:244" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 244</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.13" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lawyer's brief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid causidicis praestent magno comites in fasce libelli?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26459.14" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An attestation, certificate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">significent id libello manu sua subscripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libens: <entryFree id="n26460" type="main" key="li^bens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŭb-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. libet.</entryFree>
libenter: <entryFree id="n26461" type="main" key="li^benter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŭb-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. libet <sense id="n26461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
libentia: <entryFree id="n26462" type="main" key="li^benti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŭb-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libens</etym>, <sense id="n26462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delight, pleasure, joy</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">onustum pectus porto laetitia lubentiaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam erili filio Largitu's dictis dapsilis lubentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libentiae gratiaeque conviviorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26462.1" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lŭb-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of delight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
libentina: <entryFree id="n26463" type="main" key="Li^benti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbentīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lŭb-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, usually connected with Venus, <sense id="n26463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of sensual pleasure, Venus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a lubendo libido, libidinosus ac Venus Libentina et Libitina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 47</bibl></cit> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl>: lucus Veneris Lubentinae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64, 14</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8.</sense></entryFree>
libeo: <entryFree id="n26464" type="main" key="li^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbĕo</orth>, v. libet.</entryFree>
liber: <entryFree id="n26465" type="main" key="li_ber1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līber</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype> (old form, loebesum et loebertatem antiqui dicebant liberum et libertatem. Ita Graeci <foreign lang="greek">loibh\n</foreign> et <foreign lang="greek">lei/bein</foreign>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll.; cf. 2. Liber), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">lif-, li/ptw</foreign>, to desire; cf. Sanscr. lub-dhas, desirous; Lat. libet, libido</etym>, <sense id="n26465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that acts according to his own will and pleasure, is his own master; free, unrestricted, unrestrained, unimpeded, unshackled; independent, frank, open, bold</hi> (opp. servus, servilis). </sense><sense id="n26465.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.; constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, the <case>abl.</case>, and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26465.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum est ab eruditissimis viris, nisi sapientem liberum esse neminem. Quid est enim libertas? Potestas vivendi ut velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ille mihi liber, cui mulier imperat, cui leges imponit, praescribit, jubet, vetat? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scribendi licentiam liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri immunes ac liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">integro animo ac libero causam defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>unprejudiced, unbiased</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi ad causas solutique veniebant,</quote> <trans><tr>not under obligations, not bribed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit> § 192; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libera lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor liberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem liberam mittere adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera verba animi proferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 90</bibl></cit>: judicium <pb n="1057" /> <cb n="LIBE" /> audientium relinquere integrum ac liberum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid respuere ingenuo liberoque fastidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libero tempore, cum soluta nobis est eligendi optio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi uni vexatio direptioque sociorum impunita fuit ac libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars quaestionum vaga et libera et late patens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberum arbitrium eis populo Romano permittente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <trans><tr>full powers, unlimited authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenus,</quote> <trans><tr>unlimited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 7</bibl></cit>: custodia, <hi rend="ital">free custody</hi> (i. e. confinement to a house or to a town), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. custodia, II.: legatio, v. legatio: suffragia,</quote> <trans><tr>the right of voting freely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:211" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <trans><tr>free from intruders, undisturbed, secure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 4</bibl>: aedes, <hi rend="ital">a free house, free dwelling</hi> (assigned to the use of ambassadors of friendly nations during their stay in Rome), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:23" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectulus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not shared with a wife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: toga (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for virilis toga), <hi rend="ital">a man's</hi> (prop. of one who is his own master), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:771" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 771</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:777" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 777</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera omnia sibi servare,</quote> <trans><tr>to reserve to one's self full liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc liberiores et solutiores sumus, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est finitimus oratori poëta, numeris astrictior paulo, verborum licentia liberior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberiores litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia remissior esse debet et liberior et dulcior,</quote> <trans><tr>freer, more unrestrained, more cheerful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo liberior sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberior in utramque partem disputatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusiores liberioresque numeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia liberiora plenioraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(flumina) campo recepta Liberioris aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>freer, less impeded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tiberinus) campo liberiore natat,</quote> <trans><tr>freer, opener</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:292" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberiore frui caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>freer, opener</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 301</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberrimum hominum genus, comici veteres tradunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the frankest, most free-spoken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberrime Lolli,</quote> <trans><tr>most frank, most ingenuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26465.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exempt from, void of;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mamertini vacui, expertes, soluti ac liberi fuerunt ab omni sumptu, molestia, munere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(consul) solutus a cupiditatibus, liber a delictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab observando homine perverso liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber a tali irrisione Socrates, liber Aristo Chius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni animi perturbatione liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca abdita et ab arbitris libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl></cit>, B: <cit><quote lang="la">libera a ferro crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus liber a partibus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26465.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus omni liber curā et angore,</quote> <trans><tr>free from, without</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus cogitationibus aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens omnibus vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis odio et gratia mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni liber metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26465.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">liber laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati gens Lydia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 384</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberior campi,</quote> <trans><tr>having a wider space</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:24" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Liberum est, with <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (opinionem) sequi magis probantibus liberum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is free, permitted, allowable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies eligere certos liberum erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>.—So in <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libero, quid firmaret mutaretve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n26465.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26465.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Free</hi>, in a social point of view, <hi rend="ital">not a slave</hi> (opp. servus; <cit><quote lang="la">also to ingenuus): neque vendendam censes quae libera est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> v. 28: <cit><quote lang="la">dis habeo gratiam quom aliquot affuerunt liberae, because slaves were not permitted to testify,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>; opp. ingenuus, <hi rend="ital">free-born</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ea? ingenuan' an festucā facta e servā liberast?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jure civili, qui est matre liberā, liber est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:36:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 36, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neque censu, neque vindictā, nec testamento liber factus est (servus), non est liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (assentatio) non modo amico, sed ne libero quidem digna est,</quote> <trans><tr>of a freeman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum hominum alii ingenui sunt, alii libertini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. sqq.: ex ancilla et libero <cb n="LIBE" /> jure gentium servus nascitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 82</bibl>; cf. § 85; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 24, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n26465.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Free</hi>, in a political point of view; <cit><quote lang="la">said both of a people not under monarchical rule and of one not in subjection to another people,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex nimia potentia principum oritur interitus principum, sic hunc nimis liberum populum libertas ipsa servitute afficit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber populus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Demaratus) vir liber ac fortis,</quote> <trans><tr>democratic, republican, fond of liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates liberae atque immunes,</quote> <trans><tr>free from service</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae civitatesque liberae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libera ac foederata oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma patrem patriae Ciceronem libera dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:244" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 244</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26465.9" n="C" level="2"> In a bad sense, esp. with reference to sensual pleasure, <hi rend="ital">unbridled, unchecked, unrestrained, licentious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam liber harum rerum multarum siet (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens imprudens et liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sit adulescentia liberior,</quote> <trans><tr>somewhat freer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores soluti et liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo peccandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 177</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">freely, unrestrictedly, without let</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hinderance; frankly, openly, boldly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nihil dicit, nihil facit, nihil cogitat denique, nisi libenter ac libere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus somno relaxatus solute movetur et libere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:48:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 48, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respirare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter et libere (me gessi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid magis accusatorie quam libere dixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia libere fingimus et impune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingredi libere (oratio), non ut licenter videatur errare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 77</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberius vivendi fuit potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortius liberiusque defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberius si Dixero quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius et liberius exseritur digitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsaque tellus Omnia liberius, nullo poscente, ferebat,</quote> <trans><tr>freely, of itself, spontaneously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26466" type="main" key="li_ber2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līber</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype> (<sense id="n26466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> liberūm, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 9</bibl>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 495, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 30, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25</bibl> saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also: liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 42, § 109</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. liber</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a child.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26466.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis maximam portionem libero relinquat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 28, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26466.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur., children</hi> (freq.; but in class. Lat. only of children with reference to their parents: pueri = children in general, as younger than adulescentes; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 657 sq.). </sense><sense id="n26466.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: liberorum genus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl> (Trag. v. 347 Vahl.): liberorum sibi quaesendum gratia, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 161 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum conjugibus et liberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ex C. Fadii filiā liberos habuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos procreare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per liberos te precor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:18" default="NO">3, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:26" default="NO">26</bibl>; 6, 1, 18; 6, 5 al.: mater quae liberos, quasi oculos (amisit), orba est, Sulp. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=182" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 182</bibl> Müll.: jus trium liberorum, under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">a privilege enjoyed by those who had three legitimate children</hi> (it consisted in the permission to fill a public office before one's twenty-fifth year, and in freedom from personal burdens); <hi rend="ital">this privilege was sometimes also bestowed on those who had fewer than three children, or even none at all;</hi> also of <hi rend="ital">one child</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est sine liberis, cui vel unus filius unave filia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:148" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 30, § 76</bibl> Zumpt; cf. also Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ejus legendam filiam (virginem Vestalem) ... qui liberos tres haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores duxerant, ex quibus plerique liberos habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of grandchildren and great-grandchildren: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum appellatione nepotes et pronepotes ceterique qui ex his descendunt, continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:220" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 220</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi usque ad trinepotem, ultra hos posteriores vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus sis in liberum loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26466.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n26466.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Of sons (opp. <cb n="LIBE" /> daughters): <cit><quote lang="la">procreavit liberos septem totidemque filias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 9" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26466.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Of children in gen. = pueri: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta Chrysippi de liberorum educatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: Catus aut de liberis educandis, the title of a book by Varro, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:19:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26466.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis orbas oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerunt litterae hae sibi liberos: alia aliam scandit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26467" type="main" key="Li_ber3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Līber</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype> (Sabine collat. form, loebasius, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 7</bibl>; cf. 1. liber, and libertas <sense id="n26467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lei/bw</foreign>, to pour; <foreign lang="greek">loibh/</foreign>, a drink - offering; Lat. libare</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an old Italian deity, who presided over planting and fructification;</hi> afterwards identified with the Greek <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc dico Liberum Semelā natum, non eum, quem nostri majores auguste sancteque Liberum cum Cerere et Libera consecraverunt. Sed quod ex nobis natos liberos appellamus, idcirco Cerere nati nominati sunt Liber et Libera: quod in Libera servant, in Libero non item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertio (invocabo) Cererem et Liberum, quod horum fructus maxime necessarii ad victum: ab his enim cibus et potio venit e fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber et alma Ceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aede Liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 128</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in a pun with 1. liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 17</bibl>; so in a pun with liber, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiaque adeo me complevi flore Liberi, Magis libera uti lingua collibitum est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salve, anime mi, lepos Liberi, ut veteris ego sum cupida, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— Connected with <hi rend="ital">pater</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic factum, ut Libero patri repertori vitis hirci immolarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus et Liber pater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vestigia Liberi patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre favente Libero fetis palmitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libero patri in monte res divina celebratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26467.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud, quod erat a deo donatum, nomine ipsius dei nuncupabant: ut cum fruges Cererem appellamus, vinum autem Liberum: ex quo illud Terentii (Eun. 4, 5, 6): sine Cerere et Libero friget Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberum et Cererem pro vino et pane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 4</bibl> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">sed pressum Calibus ducere Liberum Si gestis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condita cum verax aperit praecordia Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26468" type="main" key="li^ber4" n="4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/pein</foreign>, to peel; <foreign lang="greek">le/pos, lepi/s</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">lobo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inner bark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rind</hi> of a tree. </sense><sense id="n26468.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26468.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">obducuntur libro aut cortice trunci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligatae libris (arundines),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">udoque docent (germen) inolescere libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natam libro et silvestri subere clausam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 554</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam denso fascia libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:263" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 263</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26468.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., because the ancients used <hi rend="ital">the bark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rind</hi> of trees to write upon; usually <hi rend="ital">the thin rind of the Egyptian papyrus</hi>, on which the books of the Greeks and Romans were usually written (v. Dict. of Antiq. p. 587 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">antea non fuisse chartarum usum. In palmarum foliis primo scriptitatum, dein quarundam arborum libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 69</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26468.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26468.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Paper, parchment</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rolls</hi> of any substance used to write upon (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">charta, membrana): quasi quom in libro scribuntur calamo litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26468.6" n="B" level="2"> Most freq. <hi rend="ital">a book, work, treatise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrii liber de concordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (sententias) hoc libro exposui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi in eo libro, quem de rebus rusticis scripsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros pervolutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 87, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri confectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus ad libros vacuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Platonis) in libris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Graecorum libris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum, si malus est, nequeo laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actorum libri,</quote> <trans><tr>the official gazette</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 84</bibl></cit>; cf. 2, 136; and v. Dict. Antiq. s. v. Acta.— </sense><sense id="n26468.7" n="C" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26468.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A division of a work a look</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres libri perfecti sunt de Natura Deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi tres libri (de Officiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo in novem libros distributus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum est in libro superiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 43</bibl></cit> <pb n="1058" /> <cb n="LIBE" /> sicut superiore libro continetur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus de libro Ennii annali sexto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber primus, secundus, tertius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:20" default="NO">10, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:4 al" default="NO">11, 1, 4 al.</bibl> —Sometimes, in this latter case, liber is omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">in T. Livii primo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tertio de Oratore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi tuum nuper quartum de Finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26468.9" n="2" level="3"> In relig. or pub. law lang., <hi rend="ital">a religious book, scriptures; a statute - book, code</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviris adire libros jussis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Sibylline books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum legeret libros, recordatum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in libris est Etruscorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerimoniarum,</quote> <trans><tr>rituals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26468.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A list, catalogue, register</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:71:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 71, § 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26468.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A letter, epistle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26468.12" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rescript, decree</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">liber principis severus et tamen moderatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libera: <entryFree id="n26469" type="main" key="Li_be^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>3. Liber</etym>. <sense id="n26469.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Proserpine, daughter of Ceres, and sister of</hi> Liber: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc dico Liberum Semelā natum, non eum, quem nostri majores auguste sancteque Liberum cum Cerere et Libera consecraverunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14:section=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 14, § 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres et Libera, quarum sacra, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 72</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">137: signa aënea Cereri, Libero Liberaeque posuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatio ad Cereris, Liberi Liberaeque fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which in full: familia ad aedem Cereris, Liberi Liberaeque venum iret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 55, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26469.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ariadne</hi> (because she was the wife of Bacchus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:512" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 512</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liberalia: <entryFree id="n26470" type="main" key="Li_be^ra_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībĕrālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. 3. Liber, II.</entryFree>
liberalis: <entryFree id="n26471" type="main" key="li_be^ra_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. liber</etym>, <sense id="n26471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to freedom, relating to the freeborn condition of a man</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26471.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: liberalis causa or liberale judicium, <hi rend="ital">a suit concerning a person's freedom</hi>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 12, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 1, 1</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quisquam hanc liberali caussa manu adsereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">5, 2, 68: manu eas adserat liberali causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ego liberali illam assero causa manu,</quote> <trans><tr>I formally assert that she is freeborn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberale conjugium,</quote> <trans><tr>a marriage between persons of free condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—Pleon.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te hoc triduom numquam sinam in domo esse, quin ego te liberalem liberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26471.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">befitting a freeman, gentlemanly, noble, noble-minded, honorable, ingenuous, gracious, kind</hi> (syn.: generosus, ingenuus). </sense><sense id="n26471.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes liberales,</quote> <trans><tr>befitting a freeman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: liberalia studia accipimus, quae Graeci <foreign lang="greek">e)leuqe/ria maqh/mata</foreign> appellant; <cit><quote lang="la">rhetores continebuntur, grammatici, geometrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae artes, quibus liberales doctrinae atque ingenuae continerentur, geometria, musica, litterarum cognitio et poëtarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis liberalis et digna homine nobili doctrina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de artificiis et quaestibus, qui liberales habendi, qui sordidi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalissima studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 21</bibl> 52; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes liberalioris fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>of a higher, more respectable station</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum,</quote> <trans><tr>kind, gracious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>; so, liberalibus verbis permulceri, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 871</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n26471.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26471.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bountiful, generous, munificent, liberal</hi> (syn. munificus): <cit><quote lang="la">liberales (sunt), qui suis facultatibus aut captos a praedonibus redimunt, aut aes alienum suscipiunt amicorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benefici liberalesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalissimi et beneficentissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalissimus munificentissimusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus munifica et liberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largus, beneficus, liberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 26</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26471.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis avidi, pecuniae liberales erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26471.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omne genus hominum liberalissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26471.8" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">plentiful, copious, abundant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largum et liberale viaticum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalius alimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26471.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Noble, engaging, beautiful</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illarum altera pulcer est et liberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepidā et liberali formast,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: liberales dicuntur non solum benigni, sed etiam ingenuae formae homines,<cb n="LIBE" />  Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a manner befitting a freeman, nobly, ingenuously, kindly, courteously, graciously</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26471.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo liberaliter educatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>properly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <trans><tr>kindly, courteously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione aliquem prosequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26471.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">bountifully, profusely, generously, liberally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benigne ac liberaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large et liberaliter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">204: instructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivo paulo liberalius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potui accipi liberalius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (sal) in cibis paulo liberalius aspersus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi liberalius malos odimus,</quote> <trans><tr>more abundantly, more heartily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotem largiri liberalissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 250, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalissime polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26472" type="main" key="Li_be^ra_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n26472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Liber</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>: ludi, <hi rend="ital">a festival in honor of Bacchus</hi>, = Liberalia (v. infra), Naev. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībĕrālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival in honor of Liber, celebrated on the</hi> 17<hi rend="ital">th of March, the day on which youths received the manly toga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:713" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 713</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberalium dies, a pontificibus agonium martiale appellatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18</bibl></cit>, § 22; Calend. Maff. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 411</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberalia tu accusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberalibus litteras accepi tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 1</bibl></cit>.—Called also: ludi Liberales: Liberalia Liberi festa, quae apud Graecos dicuntur <foreign lang="greek">*dionu/sia</foreign>. Libera lingua loquemur ludis Liberalibus, Naev. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.; Com. Rel. v. 113 Rib.</sense></entryFree>
liberalitas: <entryFree id="n26473" type="main" key="li_be^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. liber</etym>, <sense id="n26473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a way of thinking befitting a freeman; a noble, kind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">friendly disposition, noble spirit, kindness, affability</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26473.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitate liberos retinere satius est, quam metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ita vivunt, ut eorum probetur fides, liberalitas,</quote> <trans><tr>kindness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(L. Cassius) homo, non liberalitate, ut alii, sed ipsa tristitia et severitate popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:25:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 25, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26473.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">generosity, liberality</hi> (the usual signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: bonitas, beneficentia, benignitas): beneficentia, quam eandem vel benignitatem vel liberalitatem appellari licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas ac benignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentia liberalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea liberalitate utamur, quae prosit amicis, noceat nemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam de pietate in matrem, liberalitate in sorores?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatis virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § 10: illa quidam catachresis volunt esse, cum ... pro luxuria liberalitas dicitur; <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus equidem dissentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26473.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">a gift, present</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">decima parte liberalitatis apud quemque eorum relicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 46</bibl>: unaque et altera liberalitate locupletavit, id. Vit. Hor.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatae liberalitates ejus,</quote> <trans><tr>gifts, grants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitates Neronis revocandas curavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
