liberatio: <entryFree id="n26474" type="main" key="li_be^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libero</etym>, <sense id="n26474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freeing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">becoming free, a delivering, releasing, release, liberation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26474.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa liberatione et vacuitate omnis molestiae gaudemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam sub obtentu liberationis invadere,</quote> <trans><tr>of setting it at liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:8:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26474.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26474.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A discharge</hi> in a court of law, <hi rend="ital">an acquittal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosissimae liberationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26474.4" n="B" level="2"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a discharge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">release</hi> from debt, <hi rend="ital">a payment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberationis verbum eandem vim habet quam solutionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberationem debitori legare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>remission</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: de liberatione legata, <hi rend="ital">of releasing from a debt by last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34</bibl>, tit. 3.</sense></entryFree>
liberator: <entryFree id="n26475" type="main" key="li_be^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freer, deliverer, liberator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae liberatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri liberatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberator suus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14</bibl></cit>: scortorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In apposition: liberator populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—So as an epithet of Jupiter (like <foreign lang="greek">*zeus e)leuqe/rios</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">libare se liquorem illum Jovi liberatori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 35</bibl>.—So <cb n="LIBE" /> in eccl. Lat. freq. of God: <cit><quote lang="la">refugium meum ac liberator meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26475.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberator ille populi Romani animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
liberatrix: <entryFree id="n26476" type="gloss" key="li_be^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>liberator</etym>, <sense id="n26476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that releases</hi>, Eckhel. D. N. V. T. 6, p. 288.</sense></entryFree>
libere: <entryFree id="n26477" type="main" key="li_be^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. liber <sense id="n26477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
liberi: <entryFree id="n26478" type="main" key="li_be^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <sense id="n26478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">children;</hi> v. 2. liber.</sense></entryFree>
libero: <entryFree id="n26479" type="main" key="li_be^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n26479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> liberasso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 66</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. liber</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set free, to free, liberate</hi> (syn. vindico). </sense><sense id="n26479.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to release from slavery, to free, manumil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicas emite, liberate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberem ego te?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vindictā liberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26479.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26479.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to free, release, extricate, deliver</hi> (cf. levo) a person or thing from something (an obligation, debt, difficulty, etc.); constr.: <hi rend="ital">aliquem (aliquid) ab aliqua re</hi>, with simple <case>abl.</case>; less freq. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26479.4" n="a" level="4"> With personal objects. </sense><sense id="n26479.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque item ab eo vindico ac libero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a Venere,</quote> <trans><tr>to release one's self from one's duty to Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26479.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: divortio te liberabo incommodis, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionum laboribus senatoriisque muneribus liberatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem invidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem suspicione crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem magnā sollicitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populum metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberatus omni perturbatione animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aere alieno,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay a debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26479.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti liberari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26479.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos ex incommodis pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigales multos ac stipendiarios liberavit,</quote> <trans><tr>exempted from taxes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volusii liberandi, meum fuit consilium,</quote> <trans><tr>to release from obligation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Buthrotios cum Caesar decreto suo liberavisset, viz.,</quote> <trans><tr>from a division of their lands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">amotusque post triumphum abdicatione dictaturae terror et linguam et animos liberaverat hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(debitores) capitis deminutione liberantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:84 al" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 84 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26479.9" n="b" level="4"> With inanim. and abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">eum (mundum) ab omni erratione liberavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">below, at the end of this number: quorum linguae sic inhaererent, ut loqui non possent, eae scalpello resectae liberarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>would be set free</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: liberare agros, <hi rend="ital">to free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exempt from taxes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica liberare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberari omnia Asiae emporia portusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberata vectigalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum alii obligatum liberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberare fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>to discharge one's promise, keep one's word</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberare promissa,</quote> <trans><tr>to cancel promises, to make them void and of no effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <trans><tr>to settle debts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>: impensam, <hi rend="ital">to clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repay expenses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.—Of an abstr. object: <cit><quote lang="la">divinum animum corpore liberatum cogitatione complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26479.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26479.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To absolve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acquit</hi> in a court of justice (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">absolvo, solvo): aliquem, opp. condemnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem crimine aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 71</bibl></cit>: liberatur Milo, non eo consilio profectus esse, <hi rend="ital">is acquitted of the charge of having undertaken a journey with the design</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reum a judicibus hoc defensionis modo liberari non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—Very rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the charge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen libidinis confessio intemperantiae liberavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26479.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To clear</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pass, traverse, cross over</hi> a place <hi rend="ital">without hinderance</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:7:28" default="NO">4, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 257" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustias freti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26479.13" n="3" level="3"> Templa liberata, <hi rend="ital">freed from buildings that obstructed the view</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">having a free prospect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liberta: <entryFree id="n26480" type="main" key="li_berta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">līberta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. libertus, B.</entryFree>
libertas: <entryFree id="n26481" type="main" key="li_bertas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertas</orth> (old form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">loebertas</orth>; v. 1. liber <sense id="n26481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. liber</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition of a freeman, a being free, freedom, liberty, freedom from restraint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obligation,<pb n="1059" /> <cb n="LIBE" />  free will</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n26481.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim libertas? potestas vivendi, ut velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne majorem largiar ei, qui contra dicturus est, libertatem et licentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecidere sibi libertatem vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella dat populo eam libertatem, ut, quod velint, faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas in ridendo, in plorando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum impunitam libertatem tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas est naturalis facultas ejus quod cuique facere libet, nisi si quid vi aut jure prohibetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae omnium rerum libertatem desiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:84" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum (with licentia figurarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialogorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>the open air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf</hi> sit modo libertas, quae velit ira, loqui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi libertas imis freta tollere arenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:601" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 601</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26481.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26481.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Civil freedom, liberty</hi>, opp. to slavery: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaevae, servo Q. Crotonis, libertas data est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: alicujus libertati parcere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 206 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes homines naturā libertati studere et condicionem servitutis odisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam et libertatem perdidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas paenulast tergo tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspex his promisit libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in libertatem asserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitur puer in libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis condicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:21" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:200" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 160</bibl></cit> sq.—</sense><sense id="n26481.4" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tribus non conduci possim libertatibus, Quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias et libertates servis et ante dono datas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertatibus dandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:section=228" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, § 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatium conservandarum causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:13:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 13, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex (Fufia Caninia) cavet ut libertates servis testamento nominatim dentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26481.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in libertatem vindicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 145</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertatem vindicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26481.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Political freedom, liberty</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">independence</hi> of a people not under monarchical rule, or not subject to another people (opp. servitus and dominatus): <cit><quote lang="la">aut exigendi reges non fuerunt: aut plebi re, non verbo danda libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae nationes servitutem pati possunt: populi Romani est propria libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in optimatium dominatu vix particeps libertatis potest esse multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et a regum et a patrum dominatione solere in libertatem rem populi vindicari, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui eripere libertatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertate permanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem accipere, recuperare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus communi libertati tribuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per dolum ac proditionem prope libertas amissa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditor Romanae libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26481.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The spirit of liberty, consciousness of freedom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor animi, innata libertas, prompta excellensque virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 41, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timefacta libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26481.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Freedom of speech</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thought, frankness, boldness, candor</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi libertas, hoc pia lingua dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera de exitu ejus magna cum libertate ominatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:71:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 71, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in aliis libertas est, in aliis licentia vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectatores libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:94" default="NO">10, 1, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua comoedia facundissimae libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox honestissimae libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 30, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26481.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Freedom</hi> from taxation, <hi rend="ital">exemption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26481.10" n="F" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Līber-tas</orth>, <itype>tatis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Liberty, whose temple on the Aventine Hill was founded by the father of Tiberius Gracchus in the second Punic war; in the atrium of this temple the census-tables were preserved</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:624" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 624</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 44</bibl>; 45, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 22, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 61</bibl>. A statue of Libertas was erected by Clodius on the site of Cicero's house after it was pulled down, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libertina: <entryFree id="n26482" type="main" key="li_berti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. libertinus, II. B.</entryFree>
libertinitas: <entryFree id="n26483" type="main" key="li_berti_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libertinus</etym>, <sense id="n26483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition of a freedman</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:32" default="NO">4, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:4:2" default="NO">49, 4, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> al. <cb n="LIBE" /></sense></entryFree>
libertinium: <entryFree id="n26484" type="hapax" key="li_berti_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>libertinus</etym>, <sense id="n26484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the property obtained by a freedman on the death of his patron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenue,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Decl. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
libertinus: <entryFree id="n26485" type="main" key="li_berti_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>libertus</etym>, <sense id="n26485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the condition of a freedman</hi> (opp. ingenuus, of the condition of a freeborn person; cf. in the foll. the passage <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl>, and under II. A. the passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 10</bibl> and 11): <cit><quote lang="la">homo liber, qui se vendidit, manumissus non ad suum statum revertitur, quo se abdicavit, sed efficitur libertinae condicionis,</quote> <trans><tr>enters into the condition of a freedman, becomes a freedman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in classem mille socii navales cives Romani libertini ordinis scribi jussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 27, 3</bibl> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">navales socii cives Romani, qui servitutem servissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 18, 7</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atilius quidam libertini generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertinus homo,</quote> <trans><tr>a freedman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 124</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris libertinae sermo,</quote> <trans><tr>of a freedwoman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertina mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me libertino patre natum,</quote> <trans><tr>of a father who was a freedman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit>; 46; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt etiam libertini optimates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:13:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines libertini ordinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26485.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26485.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a freedman</hi> (in reference to his status in society or the state; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas a freedman was called libertus in reference to the manumitter): qui servus est, si manumittatur, fit libertinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servus cum manumittitur, libertinus: addictus recepta libertate ingenuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberorum hominum alii ingenui sunt, alii libertini. Ingenui sunt, qui liberi nati sunt: libertini sunt, qui ex justa servitute manumissi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1</bibl></cit>, §§ 10 and 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ita pars libertinorumst, nisi patrono qui advorsatust, ni illi offecit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. Gracchus libertinos in urbanas tribus transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertini centuriati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertinis detrahenda est auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem libertinorum adhibitum ab eo cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus omnium libertinorum scribere' historiam orsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae deberetur cuidam libertino, clienti tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde Mundior exiret vix libertinus honeste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertinis nullo jure uti praetextis licebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26485.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the son of a freedman</hi>, opp. libertus, the freedman himself (only acc. to a statement of Suetonius and of Isidore; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">ignarus, temporibus Appii et deinceps aliquandiu libertinos dictos non ipsos, qui manumitterentur, sed ingenuos ex his procreatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertorum filii apud antiquos libertini appellabantur, quasi de libertis nati. Nunc vero libertinus aut a liberto factus aut possessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: libertinos ab ingenuis adoptari jure posse, Mas. Sab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26485.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a freedwoman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuamne an libertinam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore libertinae perinfamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=51" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutior merx est Libertinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Myrtale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 33, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phryne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertinas ducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertinae quae longa veste uterentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n26486" type="main" key="li_berti_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. libertinus, II. A.</entryFree>
libertus: <entryFree id="n26487" type="main" key="li_bertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>= liberatus, from libero</etym>, <sense id="n26487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made free, set free</hi>, only as <hi rend="ital">subst., one made free, a freedman, an emancipated person</hi> (so called in reference to the manumitter; cf. libertinus, II., and on the several classes of freedmen, v. Sanders ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 3</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n26487.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26487.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">līber-tus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi servire mavelim Multo, quam alii libertus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mihi quidem libertus ullus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feci, e servo ut esses libertus mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertus Cossinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 23</bibl></cit>: Ciceronis libertus <bibl default="NO"><author>Tiro</author>, Quint. 10, 7, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudii Caesaris libertus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos nostros libertos suos fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 35, 76</bibl>: patrono<cb n="LIBE" />  in libertum manus injectio sit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26487.3" n="B" level="2"> In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lī-berta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case> libertis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 4, 2</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a freedwoman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam libertā auctus es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris meae liberta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anto niae liberta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neque ipsa patrona neque liberta capite deminuta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=51" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertis libertabusque meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:105" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 105</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. freq. in inscriptions: LIBERTIS LIBERTABVSQVE POSTERISQVE EORVM, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3006</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3026</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n26487.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a freedman</hi>, without reference to the manumitter; <cit><quote lang="la">for the usual libertinus (only in late Lat.): de libertis et eorum liberis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">de libertinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 56</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
libet: <entryFree id="n26488" type="main" key="li^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbet</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭbet</orth>, <itype>libuit</itype> (lub-) and libitum (lub-) est (in Cic. perh. only in the latter form), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n26488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> (libeo, es, etc., as a personal verb acc. to Caper ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 922</bibl> P.) [Sanscr. root lubh, cupere, desiderare; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">lif-</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">li/ptw, liy</foreign>; cf. Goth. liub-s; Germ. lieb, dear; Lat. līber], <hi rend="ital">it pleases, is pleasing, is agreeable</hi>: mihi, <hi rend="ital">I am disposed, I like, I please, I will</hi>.— Constr. with <case>nom.</case> of a demonstr. or rel. pronoun, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi> as subject, or <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> without a subject, and with or without a <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n26488.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Id (quod) libet (mihi)</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi lubet, idem mihi lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facite, quod vobis lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui facile persuasi, mihi id, quod rogaret, ne licere quidem, non modo non libere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin et poterit Naevius id quod libet et ei libebit quod non licet, quid agendum est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodcumque homini accidit libere, posse retur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi peregre, tibi quod libitum fuit, feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 77</bibl></cit>.—Once in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera item, quae cuique libuissent, dilargitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>.—Without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogita quod lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciat quod lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil vident, nisi quod lubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (senectus) efficeret, ut id non liberet quod non oporteret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 12, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa priorum scribendi, quodcumque animo flagrante liberet, simplicitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 152</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26488.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, with or without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedere aliquantisper hinc mihi intro lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi lubet nunc venire Pseudolum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 2</bibl>: Qui lubitumst illi condormiscere? <hi rend="ital">Lu.</hi> Oculis, opinor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non libet mihi deplorare vitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (orationum) alteram non libebat mihi scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo genere libitum est mihi paulo plura dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 348</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 28</bibl>.—Without a <case>dat.</case>: cum illuc ventum est, ire illinc lubet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 258 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de C. Gracchi tribunatu quid exspectem non libet augurari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in foro, quicum colloqui libeat, non habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incoharo haec studia, vel non vacabit, vel non libebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:13" default="NO">10, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Sauromatas fugere hinc libet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: libet expectare quis impendat, etc., <hi rend="ital">I should like to see who</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 95</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26488.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, with or without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ibo pro te, si tibi non libet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubiquomque libitum erit animo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adi, si libet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, age, ut libet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut libet, as an expression of assent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 38</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Quid in urbe reptas villice? <hi rend="ital">Ol.</hi> Lubet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 79</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Qua fiducia ausus ... dicere? <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Libuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 114</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26488.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbens</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭbens</orth>; LIBES, Inscr. R. N. 2598 Mommsen), entis, <hi rend="ital">P. a., that does a thing willingly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with readiness, willing, with good will, with pleasure</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n26488.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26488.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">studen hercle audire, nam ted ausculto lubens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 108</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Complectere. <hi rend="ital">An</hi> Facio lubens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illud vero illud feci, ac lubens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 37</bibl>: cum totius Italiae concursus facti illius gloriam <pb n="1060" /> <cb n="LIBI" /> libens agnovisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14, 38</bibl>.—Freq. (esp. in Cic.; Cæs. and Quint. do not use libens as an <pos>adj.</pos> at all) in the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: me, te, etc., and animo libente or libenti, <hi rend="ital">with pleasure, gladly, very willingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol me lubente facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me libente eripies mihi hunc errorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:73:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 73, 295</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libente me vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (res nostrae) tam libenti senatu laudarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Musis nos delectabimus animo aequo, immo vero etiam gaudenti ac libenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctae praefecturae libentissimis animis eum recipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam porticum redemptores statim sunt demoliti libentissimis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libentissimis Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubentissimo corde atque animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit animo libentissimo populus Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26488.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">libens or libens merito (abbreviated L. M.), a formula used in paying a vow: Jovi lubens meritoque vitulor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">EX VOTO L. M.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1412</bibl></cit>: V. S. L. M., i. e. votum solvit libens merito, or V. L. S., i. e. votum libens solvit, very freq. in inscriptions. —</sense><sense id="n26488.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">glad, happy, joyful, cheerful, merry</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">uti ego illos lubentiores faciam, quam Lubentia'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego omnes hilaros, lubentes, laetificantes faciam ut fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilarum ac lubentem fac te in gnati nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbenter</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭbenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">willingly, cheerfully, gladly, with pleasure</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 239 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 12</bibl> (Trag. v. 379 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">cenare lubenter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecastor frigida non lavi magis lubenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines te libenter studioseque audiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter verbo utor Catonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:38:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 38, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tuas litteras legi libenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter homines id, quod volunt, credunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille adjurans, nusquam se umquam libentius (cenavisse),</quote> <trans><tr>with a better appetite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil libentius audiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:11" default="NO">8, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil umquam hac carne libentius edit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 88</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: cui ego quibuscumque rebus potero libentissime commodabo, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 275, 18</bibl>: cum lubentissime edis, Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libentissime dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 9</bibl>.— Hence also, </sense><sense id="n26488.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> only <number>plur.</number> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, lit., <hi rend="ital">the things that please, one's pleasure, will, liking, humor</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">sua libita exercebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libita Caesarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libita Pallantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libethra: <entryFree id="n26489" type="main" key="Li_be_thra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībēthra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (or <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībē-thros</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 21</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*lei/bhqra</foreign>, <sense id="n26489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain near Magnesia, in Macedonia, sacred to the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26489.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībēthris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leibhqri/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Libethrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 654</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībēthrĭ-dĕs</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphae Libethrides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libethrum: <entryFree id="n26490" type="main" key="Li_be_thrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lībēthrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lei/bhqron</foreign>, <sense id="n26490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Macedonia, near the fountain of Libethra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libici: <entryFree id="n26491" type="main" key="Libi^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Libĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Transpadana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>; perh. identical with the Libui, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libidinitas: <entryFree id="n26492" type="main" key="li^bi_di^ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbīdĭnĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŭbīd-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libido</etym>, <sense id="n26492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">desire</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libidinor: <entryFree id="n26493" type="main" key="li^bi_di^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbīdĭnor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŭbīd-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id</etym>, <sense id="n26493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to indulge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gratify lust</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum libidinatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 67, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceste libidinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abeunt libidinatum ad filias Moab,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Gnost. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 138, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libidinose: <entryFree id="n26494" type="main" key="li^bi_di^no_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbīdĭnōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. libidinosus <sense id="n26494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
libidinosus: <entryFree id="n26495" type="main" key="li^bi_di^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbīdĭnōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŭbīd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>libido</etym>, <sense id="n26495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of desire, passion</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lust, selfwilled, licentious, sensual, lustful, voluptuous, libidinous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26495.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (in a bad sense), Cic. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 16</bibl> (Rep. 2, 41, 68 Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo libidinosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (isto) luxuriosius, nihil libidinosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosior es quam ullus spado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caper,</quote> <trans><tr>lecherous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: libidinosissimae liberationes,<cb n="LIBI" />  <hi rend="ital">arbitrary, self-willed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosae voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosa et intemperans adulescentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna varia et libidinosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretia,</quote> <trans><tr>extravagant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">2: libidinosam liberalitatem debiti nomine colorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —Of speech, <hi rend="ital">licentious, wanton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26495.2" n="II" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">eager, longing for</hi> a thing (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosus eloquentiae et gloriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Virg. Vel. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae sapientiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 32</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbīdĭ-nōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to one's pleasure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caprice, wilfully, wantonly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ille libidinose, quae nefarie, quae crudeliter fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid libidinose aut facias aut cogites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinose crudeliterque consulere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinosius saevire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
libido: <entryFree id="n26496" type="main" key="li^bi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbīdo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭbīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libet</etym>, <sense id="n26496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleasure, desire, eagerness, longing, fancy, inclination</hi> (cf.: appetitio, optatio, cupiditas, cupido, studium). </sense><sense id="n26496.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubilubido veniet nauseae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 779</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex bonis (perturbationibus) libidinem et laetitiam, ut sit laetitia praesentium bonorum, libido futurorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa iracundia libidinis est pars: sic enim definitur iracundia, ulciscendi libido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnibus delendi urbem libido erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus magis in decoris armis et militaribus equis quam in scortis atque conviviis libidinem habebat,</quote> <trans><tr>delighted in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta libido cum Mario eundi plerosque invaserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta libidine vulgi auditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarus sermo illis, et magna libido tacendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinae lacessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 4</bibl></cit>: est lubido with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> ( = libet, ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">est lubido orationem audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est lubido homini suo animo opsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 56 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n26496.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26496.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unlawful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inordinate desire, passion, caprice, wilfulness, wantonness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium est omnium hominum ab labore proclive ad libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libidinem suam vexare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 141</bibl></cit>: fortuna res cunctas ex lubidine magis, quam ex vero celebrat obscuratque, <hi rend="ital">arbitrarily, according to pleasure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caprice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod positum est in alterius voluntate, ne dicam libidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libidinem aliorum judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 12, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">instruitur acies ad libidinem militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26496.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sensual desire, lust</hi> (the usual meaning in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">procreandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinis ministri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commiscendorum corporum mirae libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui voluptatum libidine feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui feruntur libidine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidine accendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala libido Lucretiae per vim stuprandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem summis pariter minimisque libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:349" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltante libidine,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>passion goading on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:318" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 318</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of <hi rend="ital">unnatural lust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 23, 13</bibl>. —Of unbridled indulgence: <cit><quote lang="la">vinulentiam ac libidines, grata barbaris, usurpans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26496.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto): libidines, <hi rend="ital">voluptuous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obscene representations</hi> in painting and sculpture, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poculis libidines caelare juvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: pinxit et libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libita: <entryFree id="n26497" type="main" key="li^bi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. libet <sense id="n26497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
libitina: <entryFree id="n26498" type="main" key="Li^bi^ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbĭtīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libet, līber</etym>, <sense id="n26498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of corpses, in whose temple everything pertaining to burials was sold or hired out, and where the registers of deaths were kept</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26498.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta funerum milia in rationem Libitinae venerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>were registered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26498.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26498.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The requisites for burial, the apparatus of funerals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentia tanta erat ut Libitina vix sufficeret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it was hardly possible to bury all the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne liberorum quidem funeribus Libitina sufficiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26498.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a bier, a funeral pile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum levis arsura struitur libitina papyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:97" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26498.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The undertaker's business, the disposal of corpses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libitinam exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val.
