Max.</author> 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26498.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Death</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): multaque pars mei Vitabit <cb n="LIBR" /> Libitinam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libitinam evadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
libitinarius: <entryFree id="n26499" type="main" key="li^bi^ti_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbĭtīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Libitina</etym>, <sense id="n26499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an undertaker</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">designatores et libitinarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: si libitinarius, quos Graece <foreign lang="greek">nekroqa/ptas</foreign> vocant, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 5, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libitinensis: <entryFree id="n26500" type="main" key="Li^bi^ti_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbĭtīnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Libitina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <trans><tr>the gate at which the bodies of slain gladiators were carried out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 16, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libitus: <entryFree id="n26501" type="main" key="li^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from libet.</entryFree>
libo: <entryFree id="n26502" type="main" key="li_bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">lib-, leibw, loibh/</foreign>; cf. Līber, delibutus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n26502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take a little from</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n26502.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26502.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">libare gramina dentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to crop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:51" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26502.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26502.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take a taste of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to taste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina libant Summa leves,</quote> <trans><tr>to sip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26502.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to touch</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam celeri pede libat harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellulae limen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to kiss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 256</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26502.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour out</hi> in honor of a deity, <hi rend="ital">to make a libation of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">duo rite mero libans carchesia Baccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carchesia patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:274" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceano libemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mensam laticum libavit honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pateris altaria libant,</quote> <trans><tr>sprinkle</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum mei Tlepolemi tuo luminum cruore libabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 206 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26502.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pour out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rorem in tempora nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26502.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour out as an offering, to offer, dedicate, consecrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certasque fruges certasque bacas sacerdotes publice libanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diis dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:11:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugem Cereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noluit bibere, sed libavit eam (aquam) Domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 23, 16</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Absol., to offer libations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libant diis alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 23, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum solemni die Jovi libaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—So <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen aris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">Celso lacrimas libamus adempto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26502.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lessen, diminish, impair</hi> by taking away: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo terra tibi libatur et aucta recrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 568</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26502.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take out, cull, extract</hi> from any thing (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex variis ingeniis excellentissima quaeque libavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:29:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 29, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tuo nomini velis ex aliorum laboribus libare laudem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libandus est etiam ex omni genere urbanitatis facetiarum quidem lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a qua (natura deorum) haustos animos et libatos habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:49:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 49, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde (i. e. ex divinitate) omnes animos haustos, aut acceptos, aut libatos haberemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: neque ea, ut sua, possedisse, sed ut aliena libāsse. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 218</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26502.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To learn something of, acquire superficially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eum (informamus) qui quasdam artes haurire, omnes libare debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26503" type="main" key="Li^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Marcia <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Scribonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 263</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libonotus: <entryFree id="n26504" type="greek" key="li^bo^no^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbŏnŏtus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">libo/notos</foreign>, <sense id="n26504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wind between south and south-west</hi>, pure Lat. austro-africus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 6</bibl> Fick. (dub.; Haase, leuconotus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 13, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libra: <entryFree id="n26505" type="main" key="li_bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">li/tra</foreign>; root cli-, clino</etym>, <sense id="n26505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Roman pound</hi>, of twelve ounces: <cit><quote lang="la">as erat libra pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=169" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 169</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam auream libram pondo ex publica pecunia in Capitolio Iovi donum posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulli binas libras ponderis raro exsuperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expende Hannibalem, quot libras in duce summo invenies?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque argenti in convivio plus pondo quam libras centum inlaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dipondii pondo duas erant libras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:122" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26505.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26505.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A measure for liquids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti denos modios et totidem olei libras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26505.3" n="B. 1." level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A balance, pair of scales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in alteram librae lancem animi bona imponebat, in alteram corporis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26505.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A water-poise, plummet-level, level, line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem locus ... pari libra cum aequore maris est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: libratur <pb n="1061" /> <cb n="LIBR" /> autem dioptris aut libris aquariis aut chorobate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl>.—Hence, ad libram: alteram navem pluribus aggressus navibus in quibus ad libram fecerat turres, <hi rend="ital">of equal height</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of equal weight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26505.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Counterpoise, balance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra flatus quoque pervicax libra Bononiensibus calamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 161</bibl></cit>: aes et libra, v. aes.—</sense><sense id="n26505.6" n="4" level="3"> The constellation Libra, <hi rend="ital">The Balance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:386" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 386</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 59, § 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix aequato genitus sub pondere Librae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 545</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26505.7" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a balance</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:10" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi cunctantis libra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libralis: <entryFree id="n26506" type="main" key="li_bra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>libra</etym>, <sense id="n26506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing a pound, of a pound weight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 11, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti asses librales erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:122" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libramen: <entryFree id="n26507" type="main" key="li_bra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>libro</etym>, <sense id="n26507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a balance, poise</hi> (late Lat.).—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libramentum: <entryFree id="n26508" type="main" key="li_bra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which gives to any thing a downward pressure; weight, gravity</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26508.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 63, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26508.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fall, descent</hi> of water: <cit><quote lang="la">libramentum aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod libramentum cum exinanitum est, suscitat et elicit fontem, cum repletum, moratur et strangulat, of a spring that alternately rises and falls,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiore labro demisso ad libramentum modicae aquae receptae in fauces, palpitante ibi lingua ululatus elicitur, of the croaking of frogs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26508.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26508.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A level surface, horizontal plane</hi>: extremitatem et quasi libramentum, in quo nulla omnino crassitudo sit, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub eodem libramento stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: usque ad libramentum summi fornicis, Ael. Gall. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26508.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Evenness, equality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum hiemalium et aestivorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26508.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A straight line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si recto libramento inter solem terrasque media (luna) successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libramentum finale,</quote> <trans><tr>a boundary line</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26508.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A weight</hi> for balancing or giving motive power (ballista): <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea manus cum injecta prorae esset, gravique libramento plumbi recelleret ad solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietem admotum nunc saxis ingentibus nunc libramento plumbi gravatum ad terram urguebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 63, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">late cladem intulisset, ni duo milites vincla ac libramenta tormento abscidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libraria: <entryFree id="n26509" type="main" key="li^bra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. librarius, II., and 2. librarius, II. B.</entryFree>
librariolus: <entryFree id="n26510" type="main" key="li^bra_ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbrārĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. librarius</etym>, <sense id="n26510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a copyist, transcriber; a scribe, secretary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex librariolis Latinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
librarium: <entryFree id="n26511" type="main" key="li^bra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbrārĭum</orth>, v. 2. librarius, II. C.</entryFree>
librarius: <entryFree id="n26512" type="main" key="li_bra_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>libra</etym>. <sense id="n26512.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">containing a pound, of a pound weight</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">as,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26512.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26512.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a weight, the sixteenth part of a modius</hi>, = sextarius: sextarius aequus aequo cum librario siet, sexdecimque librarii in modio sient, Plebisc. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=246" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 246</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26512.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">she that weighed out the wool</hi> to the female slaves, <hi rend="ital">a forewoman, head-spinner</hi>, called also lanipendia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:475" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 475</bibl> (by others referred to 2. librarius); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26513" type="main" key="li^bra_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. liber</etym>, <sense id="n26513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to books</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriba librarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a copyist, transcriber of books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libraria taberna,</quote> <trans><tr>a bookseller's shop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor,</quote> <trans><tr>a transcriber of books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atramentum,</quote> <trans><tr>ink for writing books</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 52</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26513.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26513.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭ-brārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n26513.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A transcriber of books, a copyist, scribe, secretary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum ut tuis librariis daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librarii mendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 55, 8</bibl></cit>: legionis, <hi rend="ital">the secretary of the legion</hi>, Inscr. ap. Grut. 365, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:7:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26513.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bookseller</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:1" default="NO">18, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 23, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26513.5" n="3" level="3"> (Sc. doctor.) <hi rend="ital">An elementary teacher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26513.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n26513.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A female scribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Parcae) utpote librariae Superum archivumque custodes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 65</bibl></cit> (perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:476" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 476</bibl>; cf. sub 1. librarius).—</sense><sense id="n26513.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bookseller's shop;</hi> in libraria,<cb n="LIBR" />  ego et Julius Paulus poëta consederamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quispiam in libraria sedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:30:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26513.9" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place to keep books in, a bookcase, bookchest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhibe librarium illud legum vestrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libraria omnia exurerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
librate: <entryFree id="n26514" type="main" key="li_bra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. libro, <sense id="n26514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
libratio: <entryFree id="n26515" type="main" key="li_bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libro</etym>. <sense id="n26515.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making level, levelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse qui Archimedis libros legit, dicet non posse fieri veram ex aqua librationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26515.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A horizontal position, level</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa terrae librationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26515.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hurling off, hurling, slinging</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 473</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
librator: <entryFree id="n26516" type="main" key="li_bra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n26516.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leveller</hi>, esp. by means of a water-level, <hi rend="ital">a surveyor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 105" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superest ut tu libratorem vel architectum mittas, qui diligenter exploret, sitne lacus altior mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 50, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26516.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who throws</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurls weapons by hand</hi> (cf. funditor, <hi rend="ital">a slinger</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">funditores libratoresque excutere tela et proturbare hostem jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libratoribus funditoribusque attributus locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 39</bibl></cit>; Inscr. ap. Kellerm. Vigil. p. 55, n. 127.</sense></entryFree>
libratura: <entryFree id="n26517" type="main" key="li_bra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>libro</etym>, <sense id="n26517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making even</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libratus: <entryFree id="n26518" type="main" key="li_bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from libro.</entryFree>
libriger: <entryFree id="n26519" type="hapax" key="li^bri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭbrĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>4. liber-gero</etym>, <sense id="n26519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries books, a book-carrier, colporteur</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 28, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
librile: <entryFree id="n26520" type="main" key="li_bri_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <sense id="n26520.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
librilis: <entryFree id="n26521" type="main" key="li_bri_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>libra</etym>. <sense id="n26521.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of a pound, weighing a pound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Bonos. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundis librilibus sudibusque, Gallos proterrent,</quote> <trans><tr>throwing stones of a pound each</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26521.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to weighing.</hi>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n26521.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A balance, pair of scales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in librili perpendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26521.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A scale-beam</hi>: librile scapus librae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
librilla: <entryFree id="n26522" type="gloss" key="librilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">librilla</orth> <itype>appellantur instrumenta bellica saxa scilicet ad bracchii crassitudinem in modum flagellorum loris revincta</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll. (Scalig. prefers to read ‡ librilia; v. librilis, I.).</entryFree>
libripens: <entryFree id="n26523" type="main" key="li_bri^pens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrĭpens</orth>, <itype>pendis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>libra-pendo</etym>. <sense id="n26523.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who weighed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">counted out the pay to soldiers, a paymaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 43</bibl>: impubes libripens esse non potest, Ael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 892</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n26523.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who held the balance, as if to weigh out money, at nominal sales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibitis non minus quam V. testibus civibus Romanis puberibus, item libripende,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:section=113" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, § 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 19, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libro: <entryFree id="n26524" type="main" key="li_bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>libra</etym>. <sense id="n26524.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To balance, make even, level, to determine a level</hi>: aquam, <hi rend="ital">to level water</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to ascertain the fall of water by means of a level</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl>: collocationem libratam indicare, id 8, 6, 1.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libratur autem dioptris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26524.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make even</hi> or <hi rend="ital">level</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26524.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hold in equilibrium, to poise, balance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra librata ponderibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnarum turbines ita librati perpenderunt, ut puero circumagente tornarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librati pondera caeli orbe tene medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26524.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to hang</hi> or <hi rend="ital">swing, to keep suspended, keep in its place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela cadunt primo et dubia librantur ab aura,</quote> <trans><tr>are waved to and fro</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:585" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fluctus supra, vento librante, pependit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:274" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëris vi suspensam librari medio spatio tellurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26524.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to swing, to swing, sway, brandish, set in motion, hurl, dash, cast, launch, fling, throw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā telum librabat ab aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro praefixum robur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum librat ab aure intorquens jaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:576" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra libratum fulmen ab aure misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 624</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 787</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 433</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">librata cum sederit glans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29</bibl></cit>: librare se, <hi rend="ital">to balance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poise one's self, to fly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum in aëre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: saepe lapillos Tollunt; <cit><quote lang="la">his sese per inania nubila librant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haliaeetos librans ex alto sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in herba,</quote> <trans><tr>to stretch one's self out on the grass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:429" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 429</bibl></cit>: incidentis manus <cb n="LIBY" /> libratur artifici temperamento, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">librare iter,</quote> <trans><tr>to take one's way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oed. 899" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oed. 899</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26524.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26524.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make of even weight, to balance, make equal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">orbem horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:42" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina in antithetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:85" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26524.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh, ponder, consider</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">librabat metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:165" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 165</bibl></cit>: quae omnia meritorum momenta perpendit, librat, examinat, Naz. Pan. ad Const. 7: praescriptiones, Cod. Th. 8, 4, 26.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26524.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Level, horizontal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam non esse libratam, sed sphaeroides habere schema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26524.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Poised, balanced, swung, hurled, launched; forcible, powerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">librata cum sederit (glans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librato magis et certo ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>violent, powerful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleus dextra libratus ab aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per nubes aquila librata volatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:429" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 429</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libratior ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 65</bibl>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lībrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">deliberately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid eligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 713</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libs: <entryFree id="n26525" type="main" key="Libs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Libs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lips</orth>), <itype>ĭbis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*li/y</foreign>, <sense id="n26525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Libyan; subst., a Libyan;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">Antæus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26525.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The west-south-west wind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab occasu brumali Africus: Noton et Liba nominant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velivolique maris constrator leuconotos libs, Aus. Technopaegn. de Deis, 12.—Form Lips: Africus furibundus apud Graecos Lips dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Suet. Fragm. § 151 (p. 231 Reiffersch.).</sense></entryFree>
libui: <entryFree id="n26526" type="main" key="Li^bu^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbŭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Transpadana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 37</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. identical with Libici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libum: <entryFree id="n26527" type="main" key="li_bum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lībus</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 211, 31</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>libo; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 4:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 4, 22</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n26527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cake, pancake</hi> of meal, made with milk or oil, and spread with honey, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rustica liba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:670" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adorea liba per herbam Subiciunt epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:761" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 761</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena domus libis venalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:187" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 187</bibl></cit>.—Often used in offerings to the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">liba absoluta esse et rem divinam paratam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum Baccho dicemus honorem, ... et liba feremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 394</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:23" default="NO">1, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melle pater (Bacchus) fruitur, liboque infusa calenti Jure repertori candida mella damus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:761" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec te liba, Priape, quot annis Exspectare sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 33</bibl></cit>. It was customary to offer a cake to the gods on one's birthday, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 38</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, quinquagesima liba,</quote> <trans><tr>a cake offered to the gods on one's fiftieth birthday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:24:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: faciat libos quatuor, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 211, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liburni: <entryFree id="n26528" type="main" key="Li^burni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭburni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Liburnians, an Illyrian people, between Istria and Dalmatia</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Croatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 12</bibl> and 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna Liburnorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 244</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭburnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Liburnian;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">a Liburnian slave</hi>, such as were used in Rome as sedan-bearers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:239" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:75" default="NO">4, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26528.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26528.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭburnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Liburnians, Liburnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostra,</quote> <trans><tr>Liburnian ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 44.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26528.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭburna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a light, fast-sailing vessel, a Liburnian galley, a brigantine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:240" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 534</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26528.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbur-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Liburnia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:191" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 48, 73, § 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26528.5" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭ-burnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Liburnic, Liburnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liburnicae insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 30, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26528.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭburnĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, like Liburna, <hi rend="ital">a fast-sailing vessel, a brigantine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parte Liburnicarum demersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liburnus: <entryFree id="n26529" type="main" key="Li^burnus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭburnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Liburni, I.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26530" type="main" key="Li^burnus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭburnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>libet</etym>, <sense id="n26530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of lustful enjoyment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libus: <entryFree id="n26531" type="main" key="li_bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lībus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. libum <sense id="n26531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
libya: <entryFree id="n26532" type="main" key="Li^by^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbya</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbŭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 76</bibl>), ae, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbyē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*libu/h</foreign>, <sense id="n26532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Libya</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 6, 6, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecus Aristippus, qui servos proicere aurum In media jussit Libya,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Africa.</hi>—Form Libya: mundus ... premitur Libyae devexus in Austros. <pb n="1062" /> <cb n="LICE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 25</bibl>.—Form Libye: <cit><quote lang="la">Libye torretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:194" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi habe frumentum, O Libye, dum tubera mittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26532.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbycus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*libuko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Libya, Libyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapilli,</quote> <trans><tr>Numidian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyca succensae lampade Cannae,</quote> <trans><tr>the funeral pile on which Hannibal, after the battle of Cannæ, caused the bodies of the slaughtered Romans to be burned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:880" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 880</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes,</quote> <trans><tr>a table-top of citrus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: Libycus campus in agro Argeo (i. e. Argivo) appellatus, quod in eo primum fruges ex Libya allatae sunt. Quam ob causam etiam Ceres ab Argeis Libyssa vocata est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbyci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Libyans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">African</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare Libycum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Egyptian Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <trans><tr>the lion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:178" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <trans><tr>the African sky, Afríca</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 908" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 908</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <trans><tr>frizzly, woolly hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>snakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 805</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbys</orth>, <itype>yos and ys</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Libs</orth>, <itype>ĭbis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*li/bus</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Líbyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libys lectulus,</quote> <trans><tr>of citrus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26532.6" n="1" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Libyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africam initio habuere Gaetuli et Libyes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cancro (subditus) Libys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.7" n="2" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Libs</orth>. </sense><sense id="n26532.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A Libyan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.9" n="(b)" level="5"> = Africus (sc. ventus), <hi rend="ital">the south-west wind</hi> (<case>acc.</case> Liba), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.10" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbyssus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Libyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyssa arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:206" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:418" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 418</bibl></cit>: Libyssa Ceres, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Ceres among the Argives</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> (v. the passage under Libycus).—</sense><sense id="n26532.11" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbystīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*libusti=nos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Libyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes Libystini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <trans><tr>a name given to Apollo by the Sicilians, because he had delivered them by a pestilence from an attack of the Carthaginians</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.12" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭby-stis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*libusti/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Libyan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libystis ursa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26532.13" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbyus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Libyan</hi>: Libya citrus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 86, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>Libya</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
libyaegyptii: <entryFree id="n26533" type="main" key="Li^by^aegypti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭby-aegyptĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the west of</hi> Libya interior, Mela, 1, 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 43</bibl> (al. Libyes Aegyptii).</sense></entryFree>
libyphoenices: <entryFree id="n26534" type="main" key="Li^by^phoeni_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭby-phoenīces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*libufoi/nikes</foreign>, <sense id="n26534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Libyphœnicians: a Libyan people in the territory of Byzacium, descended from Phœnicians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 40, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
libysticae: <entryFree id="n26535" type="main" key="Li^bysti^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭbystĭcae fābŭlae</orth>, v. Aesopicus.</entryFree>
licens: <entryFree id="n26536" type="main" key="li^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from licet.</entryFree>
licenter: <entryFree id="n26537" type="main" key="li^center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. licet, <sense id="n26537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
licentia: <entryFree id="n26538" type="main" key="li^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>licet</etym>, <sense id="n26538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freedom, liberty, leave to do as one pleases, license</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26538.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Dae.</hi> Licet ... licet ... licet. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Hercules istum infelicet cum sua licentia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis nostra Academia magnam licentiam dat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueris non omnem ludendi licentiam damus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum licentiae dabat gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absolvendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lasciviendi permittere militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26538.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26538.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Liberty which one assumes, boldness, presumption, license</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ad scribendi licentiam liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Democrito omnino haec licentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per intercalandi licentiam,</quote> <trans><tr>by arbitrary intercalation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 40</bibl></cit>.—Freq. of style: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenilis quaedam dicendi impunitas et licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26538.4" n="2" level="3"> In rhet. as a figure of speech, = <foreign lang="greek">parrhsi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">boldness, freedom</hi> of speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:58" default="NO">4, 1, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26538.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unrestrained liberty, unbounded license, dissoluteness, licentiousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deteriores omnes sumus licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia illaec licentia evadet in aliquod magnum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum infinita atque intoleranda licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia libidoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere impunitatem et licentiam sempiternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum licentiae nisi Carneades restitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: malle licentiam suam quam aliorum libertatem,<cb n="LICE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sullani temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>lawlessness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indomitam Refrenare (licentiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiam coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertatibus quoque dandis nimiam licentiam compescuit lex Fufia Caninia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:228" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 228</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things: magna gladiorum est licentia, <hi rend="ital">the license of the sword is great</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">daring murders are prevalent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa licentia ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 309</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26538.6" n="C" level="2"> Personified as <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum Licentiae (for Libertatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. Libertas.</sense></entryFree>
licentiatus: <entryFree id="n26539" type="hapax" key="li^centi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcentĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>licentia</etym>, <sense id="n26539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">freedom, license</hi>: meo licentiatu, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 6</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 71 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
licentiose: <entryFree id="n26540" type="main" key="li^centi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcentĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. licentiosus <sense id="n26540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
licentiosus: <entryFree id="n26541" type="main" key="li^centi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcentĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>licentia</etym>, <sense id="n26541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of freedom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">license, over-free, unbridled, unrestrained, wanton, licentious</hi> (post-Aug.): (ebor dicere) non minus est licentiosum, quam si sulfuri et gutturi subicerent in genitivo litteram o mediam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversatio cum viris licentiosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Excerpt. Contr. 6:8:section=5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Excerpt. Contr. 6, 8, § 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidini licentiosissimum spatium praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Pelag. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Pelag. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcentĭōsē</orth> (late Lat. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. ad Lit. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. ad Lit. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
licentius: <entryFree id="n26542" type="main" key="Li^centi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭcentĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Christian poet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Epist. 47, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
liceo: <entryFree id="n26543" type="main" key="li^ce^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, cĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root rik-, riktas, empty; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lip-, lei/pw</foreign>, leave; Lat. lic-, linquo, licet, liceor; cf. Germ. leihen, verleihen</etym>, <sense id="n26543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be for sale; to have a price put upon</hi> it, <hi rend="ital">to be valued, esteemed at</hi> so much. </sense><sense id="n26543.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vaenibunt, quiqui licebunt, praesenti pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti licuisse tu scribis (hortos),</quote> <trans><tr>how much they were valued at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius assis Non umquam pretio pluris licuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26543.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the seller, <hi rend="ital">to offer for sale, to fix the price, to value</hi> at so much (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">percontanti quanti liceret opera effecta, parvum nescio quid dixerat,</quote> <trans><tr>how much he asked for them, what he held them at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo cum pretio diu liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:66:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 66, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n26544" type="main" key="liceo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">liceo</orth>, v. licet.</entryFree>
liceor: <entryFree id="n26545" type="main" key="li^ce^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcĕor</orth>, <itype>lĭcĭtus, 2</itype>, <sense id="n26545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root lic-; v. 1. liceo], <hi rend="ital">to bid</hi> on goods at an auction (class.). </sense><sense id="n26545.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">licetur Aebutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liciti sunt usque adeo, quoad, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digito liceri (because, in bidding, the finger was raised),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">27: omnia Aeduorum vectigalia parvo pretio redemta habere, propterea, quod illo licente, contra liceri audeat nemo,</quote> <trans><tr>to bid against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immoderatius liceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec licendi finem factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26545.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to bid for, make an offer for</hi>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredes Scapulae si istos hortos liceri cogitant,</quote> <trans><tr>to bid on the gardens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hortos liceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et centum Graecos curto centusse licetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:191" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 191</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n26545.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to appraise, estimate, value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc avidi matronam oculi licentur,</quote> <trans><tr>appraise her, reckon at what price she can be robbed of her honor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
licerianus: <entryFree id="n26546" type="main" key="Li^ceri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĭcerĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Licerium</hi> (in Aquitania), <hi rend="ital">Licerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
licet: <entryFree id="n26547" type="main" key="li^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭcet</orth>, <itype>cŭit and cĭtum est, 2</itype> (old form, licessit for licuerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 13</bibl>; <sense id="n26547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> liceto, Lex ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 202, 508 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> [root lic-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lip-</foreign>; v. 1. liceo], <hi rend="ital">it is lawful, it is allowed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permitted; one may</hi> or <hi rend="ital">can, one is at liberty</hi> to do so and so; constr. with <hi rend="ital">neutr. of the demonstr.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel. pron.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, with or without a <case>dat.</case>, or <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or (more freq.) with the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or entirely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26547.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">neutr. of the demonstr.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel. pron.</hi> as a subject, with or without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licere id dicimus, quod legibus, quod more majorum institutisque conceditur. Neque enim quod quisque potest, id ei licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui facile persuasi, mihi id, quod rogaret, ne licere quidem, non modo non lubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid deceat vos, non quantum liceat vobis, spectare debetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si hominibus tantum licere judicas, quantum possunt: vide, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illud non licet, Saltem hoc licebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: neque idem ubique<cb n="LICE" />  aut licet aut decorum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in foro non expedit, illic nec liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin et poterit Naevius id quod lubet et ei lubebit, quod non licet, quid agendum est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil, quod per leges liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tantum de te licuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 502</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 172, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tantum fata licere In generum voluere tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1025" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1025</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantumque licere horruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:670" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 670</bibl></cit>.—Rarely in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in servum omnia liceant, est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26547.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>, with or without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: neque terram inicere, neque cruenta Convestire corpora mihi licuit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 168 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">licet nemini contra patriam ducere exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi id facere liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Catoni licuit Tusculi se in otio delectare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris crimine liceat Cn.
